full_text: Viavi Solutions Inc. released new industry data revealing that the number of cities with 5G networks now stands at 1,947 globally in their report “The State of 5G,” now in its sixth year.

title: Keysight Enables GCF to Activate Certification of 5G mmWave Devices in SA Mode
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. has enabled the Global Certification (GCF) to activate a certification test plan that validates compliance to specifications defined by the global standards organization 3GPP, covering RF performance and protocol validation of 5G new radio (NR) mmWave devices operating in standalone (SA) mode.

title: TLC Solutions Selects Benetel n78 RUs to Support Indigo 5G Tactical Solutions
full_text: OpenRAN radio specialist Benetel announced that its radio units (RUs) have been selected by TLC Solutions for integration into the company's Indigo 5G tactical systems.

title: Sierra Wireless Announces Availability of Next-Generation RF Optimized 5G Module
full_text: Sierra Wireless announced the availability of its next-generation 5G mobile broadband embedded modules, the RF optimized EM92 Series.

title: GSA: Number of Commercially Available 5G Devices Passes the 1000 Milestone
full_text: The GSA confirmed the number of commercially available 5G devices surpasses 1,000 for the first time, representing 74.9 percent of all announced 5G devices.

title: Keysight Enables Xiaomi to Validate 5G Technology Underpinning Smartphones and IoT Devices
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced that Xiaomi has selected Keysight's automated field-to-lab device test platform solutions, which leverages AI software and channel emulation capabilities to validate 5G technology underpinning smartphones and IoT devices.

title: Rakuten Symphony Selects VIAVI to Accelerate 5G Open vRAN From Lab to Field
full_text: Viavi Solutions Inc. announced that Rakuten Symphony has chosen the VIAVI TM500 Network Tester to validate performance of its solutions from the lab to the field. The principal objective of this testbed is to maximize resolution of any issues in the lab  to accelerate deployment at scale.

title: NSF Announces Investment in Multi-Sector Partnership to Accelerate Research in Next-Gen Networking and Computing
full_text: The U.S. National Science Foundation announced a new investment of over $37 million aimed at the development of intelligent, resilient and reliable next-generation networks, called RINGS.

title: Strategy Analytics: Qualcomm Dominates the Baseband Market with 800+ Million Shipments in 2021
full_text: The global cellular baseband processor market posted 19.5 percent to $31.4 billion in 2021, according to Strategy Analytics' Handset Component Technologies (HCT) service report.

title: Zynq UltraScale+ RFSoC ZCU670 Evaluation Kit Available Now
full_text: N/A

title: FCC Selects Anritsu Test Solutions to Conduct SAR and HAC Compliance Tests
full_text: Anritsu Company announced that the FCC has selected the Radio Communication Test Station MT8000A, Radio Communication Analyzer MT8821C and Signalling Tester MD8475B  to conduct compliance tests on 5G mobile devices.

title: Illinois Electric Cooperative Selects Ericsson, XtremeLTE to Connect Underserved Rural Communities
full_text: Illinois Electric Cooperative has selected Ericsson, through its strategic partnership with XtremeLTE, to modernize networks in rural Pike County, Ill. The project involves Fixed Wireless Access delivered through the CBRS spectrum.

title: AIS, Qualcomm and ZTE Announce First 5G NR-DC Showcase for 2.6 and 26 GHz in Thailand
full_text: AIS, Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. and ZTE announced the  first 5G new radio dual connectivity (NR-DC) showcase in the field with 2.6 and 26 GHz, achieving 8.5 Gbps peak downlink speed and 2.17 Gbps peak uplink speed with a single mobile device.

title: ADI’s mmWave 5G Chipset Addresses Full 5G NR FR2 Spectrum For Simpler, Smaller Radios
full_text: Analog Devices, Inc. (ADI) introduced a mmWave 5G front-end chipset that addresses required frequency bands enabling designers to reduce complexity and bring smaller and more versatile radios to market faster.

title: 5G: The Market GaN Needs, Discussed by IDTechEx
full_text: IDTechEx’s latest research report on “Thermal Management for 5G 2022-2032” finds that GaN has a significant opportunity within the 5G market and this creates a downstream effect on other components such as die attach materials.

title: Open RF Association Drives Industry Collaboration to Develop 5G Device Power Profile Study
full_text: The Open RF Association announced it completed the initial phase, in collaboration with Signals Research Group, of a study determining RF power levels used in 5G handsets to help the industry better optimize data throughput performance and ultimately improve battery life.

title: Keysight Selected by VTT to Support Open Testing and Integration Facility in Finland
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced that VTT Technical Research Centre of Finland Ltd. has selected Keysight Open Radio Architect (KORA) solutions to build an open testing and integration facility in support of an O-RAN ecosystem.

title: ALCAN and AGC Collaborate to Develop Transparent Antenna for mmWave 5G FWA
full_text: ALCAN Systems and AGC Inc. announced the successful development of transparent antennas for indoor mmWave Fixed Wireless Access (FWA) following rigorous demonstrations at ALCAN’s head office in Darmstadt.

title: NXP Helps Expand 5G Coverage With New Family of RF Power Transistors for mMIMO
full_text: NXP® Semiconductors announced a new series of RF power discrete solutions for 32T32R active antenna systems, complementing NXP’s existing portfolio of discrete GaN power amplifier solutions for 64T64R radios.

title: Frequency Matters, March 28: Retrospective Look, Cable/Connectors, Mini-Circuits Interview, News
full_text: Microwave Journal Editors, Pat Hindle and Gary Lerude, celebrate the 200th episode with a retrospective look at how technology and the industry has advanced since the early years of the show. They also look at the March Cable and Connector supplement, Satellite News/Event and interview with Mini-Circuits about their new high frequency, high power amplifier products.

title: 5G Forecast: 1.3 Billion by Year-End 2022
full_text: After three full years of growth, global wireless 5G adoption has reached the rapid acceleration phase, having exceeded a half-billion connections by the end of 2021 and forecast to reach 1.3 billion by the end of this year according to data from Omdia, said 5G Americas.

title: Verizon Boosts 5G FWA Strategy with Cradlepoint Wideband Adapter
full_text: Verizon Business and Cradlepoint announced the certification of Cradlepoint’s W1850 5G Wideband Adapter to provide C-Band spectrum connectivity across Verizon’s 5G Ultra-Wideband (UWB) Network.

title: Ericsson Embraces 5G Edge Opportunity with Local Packet Gateway

title: Hughes Selected to Deploy Private 5G Network for DOD
full_text: Hughes Network Systems, LLC announced the award of an $18 million contract from the Department of Defense  to deploy a standalone 5G network at Naval Air Station Whidbey Island in Washington state.

title: DOD Selects Vectrus for Development of 5G Smart Warehouse
full_text: Vectrus, Inc. has been selected by the Department of Defense (DOD) to complete the final phases of application development for a 5G Smart Warehouse at Naval Base Coronado (NBC).

title: Broadband Forum Achieves 5G Convergence Milestone
full_text: The convergence of wireless and wireline networks to provide a seamless 5G experience no matter how consumers are connected has been made possible for the first time as Broadband Forum completes Phase 2 of its 5G work.

title: Keysight's New 5G Test Cases Support China Mobile’s CAT Plan
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced an extended range of 5G new radio (NR) test cases for device and module validation according to a carrier acceptance test (CAT) plan defined by China Mobile Communications Corporation (CMCC).

title: Ericsson and Vodafone Create UK’s First On-Demand 5G Network Slice
full_text: Ericsson and Vodafone have successfully completed the U.K.’s first 5G standalone (SA) network slicing trial in a joint lab demonstration to create on-demand 5G connectivity and dedicated performance for consumer and business customers.

title: Mobile Network Testing of 5G NR FR1 and FR2 Networks: Challenges and Solutions
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. has been granted the first Federal Communications Commission (FCC) Spectrum Horizons Experimental license for developing 6G technology in sub-Terahertz (THz) frequency bands, between 95 GHz and 3 THz.

full_text: N/A

title: MWC 2022 Barcelona - Getting Back to Normal
full_text: MWC2022 Barcelona welcomed more than 61,000 physical attendees from more than 200 countries and territories. While not the 100,000+ that typically attend, it was enough to create significant buzz as we make our way back to physical events.

title: Keysight Delivers Significant Enhancements to 5G Network Emulation Solution Platform
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. delivered a range of enhancements to the company's 5G Network Emulation Solution that supports 3GPP Rel-15/16/17 features and enable chipset and device makers to quickly and confidently develop designs with advanced 5G capabilities.

title: ZTE: Technological Innovation is the Driving Force for the Development of mmWave
full_text: ZTE Corporation has explored on how 5G mmWave is unlocking the full potential of 5G on March 2 at GSMA’s 5G mmWave Summit during MWC Barcelona 2022.

title: CEA and Spectronite Develop Software Radio For Spectrally Efficient Backhaul Solutions
full_text: CEA and Spectronite announced they have adapted and optimized CEA-Leti’s spectrally efficient waveform with enhanced spectral efficiency for Spectronite’s X-Series modem for 5G systems.

title: WNC and Movandi Partner to Deliver Innovative Dual-Band 5G mmWave Smart Repeaters
full_text: Movandi announced that it has partnered with Wistron NeWeb Corp. (WNC) to deliver innovative dual-band smart repeaters optimized for indoor networks.

full_text: At MWC 2022, ZTE Corporation has launched its Reconfigurable Intelligent metaSurface (RIS) solution, a cross-border collaboration between electromagnetic meta-materials and modern wireless communication technology.

title: Anokiwave Announces mmWave 5G Fourth Generation IC Family

full_text: NXP® Semiconductors announced that NXP’s Layerscape® and Layerscape Access family of processors have been chosen by Compal Electronics to power its new 5G integrated small cell solution.

full_text: MediaTek Inc. and Anritsu Corporation announced that the first dual active protocol stack (DAPS) handover for 5G New Radio (NR) has been verified with a device containing the MediaTek M80 5G modem and Anritsu’s MT8000A Radio Communication Test Station with Rapid Test Designer application software.

full_text: Marvell announced new 5G Open RAN DU and RU solutions with customers and partners powered by the company’s flagship OCTEON Fusion baseband processor, featuring a comprehensive suite of 5G Layer 1  inline hardware accelerators and O-RAN standards support.

full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. has signed a memorandum of understanding with NTT DOCOMO, INC. to support the development and deployment of multi-vendor 5G networks built on open standard interfaces, driving the growing maturity of open radio access network (RAN) ecosystems.

full_text: Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. announced the Snapdragon X70 5G Modem-RF System, its 5th generation modem-to-antenna 5G solution, introducing the first 5G AI processor in a modem-RF system to harness the power of AI for breakthrough 5G performance.

full_text: Movandi announced that it has plans to collaborate with Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. to expand the adoption of 5G mmWave deployment for indoor and outdoor scenarios.

title: Rohde & Schwarz and VIAVI Solutions Jointly Offer O-RAN Radio Unit Conformance Test Solution
full_text: Rohde & Schwarz and Viavi Solutions Inc. announced they have partnered to offer an integrated solution for conformance testing of O-RAN Radio Units.

full_text: Ericsson continues to strengthen its radio access network (RAN) portfolio with solutions that address the 5G rollout and sustainability goals of communications service providers.

title: Sivers Semiconductors and Mixcomm: Bringing mmWave Technology to New Markets
full_text: Microwave Journal Media Director, Pat Hindle, talks with Sivers Semiconductors CEO, Anders Storm; Mixcomm CEO, Mike Noonen; and Mixcomm Co-Founder/CTO, Harish Krishnaswamy, about the synergies of bringing the companies together, expertise in semiconductor and packaging technologies and future plans including a 5G metaverse device with 360 degree antenna coverage.

title: Global 5G SA Infrastructure Market to Exceed $112B by 2027
full_text: The "5G and Beyond 5G Technology, Infrastructure, and Devices 2022 - 2030" report has been added to ResearchAndMarkets.com's offering.

title: Keysight and Samsung Sign MoU to Advance Research and Development of 6G Technology
full_text: The two companies will work together to develop test and verification technologies for 6G wireless systems.

full_text: Anokiwave, Inc. introduced the industry’s first single-chip dual-channel IF up-/down-converter with fully integrated LO synthesizer, delivering a single-chip multi-band solution.

title: Richardson RFPD Announces All-in-One 5G mMIMO RF PAs and RapidRF Demo Platforms from NXP
full_text: Richardson RFPD, Inc announced the availability and full design support capabilities for several new RF power multi-chip modules and the RapidRF demonstration platform from NXP Semiconductors.

title: Boosting 5G Network Performance Using Self Interference Cancellation
full_text: With 3GPP finally recognizing these benefits and including it in the Release 18 standard, it is now nearly certain that the access network is going Full Duplex making Self-Interference Cancellation technology a critical piece of the puzzle. Read about the progress being made.

full_text: Rohde & Schwarz is bringing its well-established R&S CMX500 5G radio communication tester with a major upgrade to MWC Barcelona 2022.

full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced that vivo has expanded the use of Keysight's 5G device test solutions to accelerate verification of designs that support 5G new radio (NR) 3GPP Release 16 (Rel-16) features.

full_text: Anokiwave, Inc. introduced its fourth generation high efficiency multi-band Si-based IC family, pushing levels of performance and cost so network operators can start to accelerate the builds of greener, lower cost and smaller form factor mmWave 5G radios, for every 3GPP FR2 band.

title: Xilinx to Showcase End-to-End 5G O-RAN Solutions at MWC
full_text: Xilinx will be showcasing the breadth of its 5G O-RAN offerings, February 28 to March 3, in Hall 2, Stand 2M61, at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona.

title: Keysight Helps LG Electronics to Demonstrate 6G RFFE Module at Korea Science and Technology Exhibition
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. helped LG Electronics to demonstrate a 6G radio frequency front-end (RFFE) module at the 2021 Korea Science and Technology Exhibition held in Ilsan, Korea, December 22-24, 2021.

title: Smartphone OEMs To Drive RFFE Industry Practices Through a Defined Consumer-Oriented Roadmap
full_text: Netscribes, Inc. has published its market and industry findings on RFFE for smartphones in the 5G era, including an examination of the RFFE industry at a strategic framework level, an overview of relevant market size and various consumer factors.

full_text: ATIS’ Next G Alliance announced publication of the Roadmap to 6G, presenting the first 6G vision for North America and major steps that industry, government and academia should take.

full_text: Anritsu Company introduces the MS27201A Remote Spectrum Monitor series that includes the industry’s first remote spectrum monitor that covers 43.5 GHz to support new satellite downlink bands. Combining high RF performance with supporting PC software, the MS27201A series delivers a unique package for long-term monitoring in a variety of commercial and regulatory environments.

title: Essence Group Joins Qualcomm Smart Cities Accelerator Program
full_text: Essence Group announced that it has joined the Qualcomm® Smart Cities Accelerator Program from Qualcomm Technologies, Inc., providing its suite of its security and safety products to help protect workers, buildings and assets.

full_text: A new 5G Americas white paper provides a deep dive into 5G non-terrestrial-based communications.

full_text: With Ericsson, Deutsche Telekom has extended its campus network portfolio to offer location-specific 5G mobile networks for companies based on 5G SA.

full_text: The GSMA has published an analysis showing how robust 5G growth in the Middle East and North Africa has followed ambitious 5G spectrum assignments.

full_text: Later 6G reflective intelligent surfaces (RISs) everywhere will do more than smarten up and redirect the beams but actually amplify them, charging your phone and operating devices with no power. Making, manipulating and using the beams all potentially benefit from graphene.

title: How the RF Front-end World is Being Ruled in the 5G Era

After improving mobile broadband experience on smartphones and connecting the unconnected on a broadband network (through FWA for example), network operators intend to extend their business footprint across other market verticals, including industrial automation and automotive connectivity. These new business opportunities are becoming addressable thanks to the coverage and implementation work done through consumer 5G today.

title: GaN and GaAs: 5G Brings Thriving Business Opportunities
full_text: Following the deployment of higher frequencies in sub-6 GHz 5G bands, GaN demonstrated properties that exceed the existing Silicon based LMDOS technology in terms of higher bandwidth and higher power density requirements. With the emerging market opportunities, the following questions are being raised in the industry: What is the business outlook for the GaN RF market with the arrival of 5G? Which technology, GaN-on-Silicon Carbide (SiC) or GaN-on-Silicon, will more successfully grow its market? Which business models will dominate in the market? How will the GaN RF business evolve in view of the US-China tension, which is becoming more sensitive than ever?

title: 5G Multiport Testing: Different Configurations for Different Components
full_text: Driving down the cost of test is a key challenge in high-volume component manufacturing. The trend towards adding more ports on components such as antennas, cables, and frontend modules (FEMs) increases the need for accurate and fast multiport network analysis. Minimizing operator intervention and reducing connection and calibration times is essential to increase measurement throughput. Optimizing your vector network analyzer (VNA) configuration is critical to minimizing the cost of test in manufacturing. That’s when the multiport and multisite testing concepts come in, but there are challenges.

The combination of R&S BTC Broadcast Test Center and RFSpark RF automation unleashed the full capacity of R&S BTC, The successful deployment at the Vietnam Telecommunications Authority (VNTA) is the result of Rohde & Schwarz collaborating close with local system integrator Spark Systems.

title: Element and PCTEST Partnership Acquires 5G RF and RRM Testing Solutions from Rohde & Schwarz
full_text: PCTEST Engineering Laboratory, LLC, which recently became part of the Element Materials Technology Group, has acquired the latest 5G test solutions from Rohde & Schwarz for RF and RRM testing in the FR1 and FR2 frequency ranges.

title: Thermal Gel From Henkel Lets 5G Telecom Components Go Vertical
full_text: Henkel announced the launch of a new gel thermal interface material (TIM) that can withstand the environmental and positioning demands of today’s infrastructure components.

title: Open RAN Policy Coalition Launches to Expand Global Advanced Wireless Supply Chain
full_text: Thirty-one global technology companies launched the Open RAN Policy Coalition to promote policies that will advance the adoption of open and interoperable solutions in the radio access network. Ericsson and Nokia are notably absent.

title: T-Mobile Achieves Significant 5G Firsts with Cisco, Ericsson, MediaTek, Nokia, OnePlus and Qualcomm
full_text: T-Mobile U.S., Inc. announced several important world’s first milestones for standalone architecture (SA) 5G. These achievements, using the Un-carrier’s newly built 5G core, bring T-Mobile closer to taking its nationwide 5G network to the next level.

title: Keysight First to Gain Approval from 3GPP for 5G NR Protocol Test Cases
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced that the company is the first to gain approval from 3GPP for 5G new radio (NR) protocol test cases that support carrier aggregation (CA) technology, using its Protocol Conformance Toolset.

title: Anritsu ME7873NR Achieves GCF Spurious Test Validation on FR2 (mmWave) 5G RF Conformance Testing
full_text: Anritsu Corporation President Hirokazu Hamada announced that Anritsu’s New Radio RF Conformance Test System ME7873NR has achieved an industry-first validation for Global Certification Forum (GCF) certification of Frequency Range (FR2) spurious emissions tests based on 3GPP specifications.

title: 5G mmWave and massive MIMO Market
full_text: According to Sachin Garg, Associate Vice President, Semiconductor and Electronics at MarketsandMarkets, “mmWave is likely to play a key role to support the burgeoning mobile data traffic growth. High data transfer rate offered by this spectrum, the growing involvement of various telecom service providers, and favorable federal mandates are driving the market growth for this frequency band.”

title: ZTE and China Unicom Implement Industry's First Tri-RAT Dynamic Spectrum Sharing Solution
full_text: ZTE Corporation announced that in partnership with China Unicom, ZTE has implemented the industry’s first Tri-RAT dynamic spectrum sharing solution, SuperDSS, in the live network of the Henan Branch of China Unicom.

title: ZTE and Qualcomm Achieve Industry’s First Voice Over NR Call in the 700 MHz Band
full_text: ZTE Corporation with Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. achieved the industry’s first 5G-enabled Voice over New Radio (5G VoNR) call over the 700 MHz band, and was completed using commercial products at the Xi’an Test Base.

title: Keysight Launches First Emulation Software for Validating O-RAN Compliant Radio Units
full_text: Keysight Technologies has announced Open RAN Studio, which Keysight says is the first O-RAN distributed unit emulation software for validating O-RAN compliant radio units.

title: Keysight Launches New 5G Core Network Test Solution—LoadCore
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced LoadCore 5G Core (5GC) Testing software and China Mobile Research Institute (CMRI) has selected LoadCore to validate performance using 5GC network equipment provided by major infrastructure vendors.

title: CommAgility Releases New Software to Simplify Development of 5G Small Cells
full_text: CommAgility announced the general availability of its PHYRefChain-5G software which supports the development of 5G base station technology. Designed for 5G product developers working on SATCOM, wireless test, military communications and private network designs, this new software enables fast development and deployment of specialized 5G solutions for customized and unique applications.

title: SCF Report Shows Small Cells Hold the Key to Unlocking Private Cellular Network Opportunity
full_text: Small Cell Forum (SCF) published its analysis of the burgeoning market for small cell-based private networks, outlining market drivers, use cases and recommendations for LTE-based networks and examining their evolution to 5G. The research shares insights gained by leading deployers of how different public and private sector organizations are benefiting from robust cellular connectivity, customized to their specific applications.

title: NXP Supplies Murata with RF Front-end ICs for Wi-Fi 6 Modules
full_text: NXP Semiconductors N.V. announced it has collaborated with Murata, a system-in-package integrator for 5G mobile platforms, to deliver the industry’s first RF front-end modules designed with the latest Wi-Fi 6 standards. Together, the companies are delivering a solution that can reduce design times, improve time-to-market and save board space in next generation Wi-Fi 6 implementations.

title: Anritsu Achieves Leading Coverage of 5G NR Protocol Conformance Test Validations
full_text: Anritsu Corporation announced that the PCS Type Certification Review Board (PTCRB) Validation Group (PVG) has approved the highest number of 5G new radio (NR) Protocol Conformance tests on Anritsu’s 5G NR Mobile Device Test Platform ME7834NR at its PVG#88 meeting and officially accepted during the PTCRB#103 meeting.

title: Keysight’s 5G Solutions Enable Hisense Comm to Accelerate Development of High-Quality 5G Devices
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced that Qingdao Hisense Communication Co., Ltd., has selected Keysight's 5G test platform to validate the performance of their 5G designs and accelerate the market introduction of high-quality 5G devices, including smartphones, tablets and other mobile devices.

title: GSA: Commercially Available 5G Devices Surge by 41 Percent in April
full_text: The Global mobile Suppliers Association (GSA) reported that the number of commercially available 5G devices had increased by 41 percent in the last month, with 95 different 5G devices now commercially available out of over 280 announced devices.

title: Frequency Matters April 17: Products, News and Gapwaves Interview
full_text: Microwave Journal editors Pat Hindle and Gary Lerude cover the April issue products, latest industry news and interview Gapwaves CTO, Thomas Emanuelsson, about their unique waveguide technology and its applications.

title: 5G Startup Movandi Announces $27M Series C Funding to Accelerate 5G Network Deployment
full_text: Movandi announced a $27 million series C funding round from WRVI Capital, Cota Capital and DNX Ventures. The funding will enable Movandi to ramp and expand its active router/repeater platform, RF front-end and open radio access network (ORAN) radio units, which it expects to deploy this year.

title: Samsung and Xilinx Team Up for Worldwide 5G Commercial Deployments
full_text: Xilinx, Inc. announced that the Xilinx® Versal™ adaptive compute acceleration platform will be utilized by Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd., for worldwide 5G commercial deployments. Xilinx Versal ACAPs provide a universal, flexible and scalable platform that can address multiple operator requirements across multiple geographies.

title: Skyworks New 5 GHz Front-end Module Supports Simultaneous Wi-Fi Connectivity and LAA Support
full_text: Skyworks has introduced the SKY5®-5501-11, a 5 GHz front-end module (FEM) designed for Wi-Fi enabled devices including handsets and tablets.

title: Resonant Inc. Expands XBAR® Performance to Address 5G-Wi-Fi Co-existence Issues
full_text: Resonant Inc. announced expanded performance for its XBAR® high-frequency resonator for RF filters that can manage the co-existence of 5G and Wi-Fi 6 and 6E networks, protecting each from co-interference and the resulting degradation in network performance.

title: Keysight Technologies Selected by Rakuten Mobile for Speed Introduction of High-Performance 5G Services
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced that Rakuten Mobile has selected the company's 5G network and channel emulation solutions in testing, validation and optimization of infrastructure and devices to speed introduction of high-performance 5G services.

title: Insights Into Digital Predistortion System Design
full_text: China's big three telecom carriers, China Mobile, China Unicom and China Telecom, have unveiled a new 5G-enabled messaging service, by publishing a white paper for the 5G messaging service, which specifies technical details to invite smartphone makers to support the new service. ZTE Corporation helped the Zhejiang branch of China Mobile send China’s first 5G message based on GSMA UP2.4 standard in Hangzhou, China, thereby making China Mobile the first Chinese operator to implement the 5G Message Center

title: China's Big Three Telecom Carriers Have Unveiled a New 5G-enabled Messaging Service
full_text: N/A

title: Strategy Analytics: RF Front End Market Stalls
full_text: Strategy Analytics said that the market for RF front-end components was flat in 2018 and 2019 and will remain flat in 2020, despite frequent claims by companies and analysts of unbridled RF growth from 4G and 5G.

title: Nokia Expands 5G Offering with New Radio Access AirScale Solutions
full_text: Nokia announced that it has expanded its AirScale portfolio with a number of new product innovations designed to fulfill the evolving needs of 5G networks and help mobile operators realize the full potential of 5G. This includes the launch of a dynamic spectrum sharing software upgrade for existing Nokia AirScale base stations and the Nokia AirScale All-in-Cloud base station, boosting network efficiency.

title: ThinKom Aero Satellite Antennas Fully Comply with International Non-Interference Rules
full_text: ThinKom Solutions, Inc., announced that its phased-array satellite antennas are in full compliance with the latest rules from international regulatory bodies governing evolving interference threats.

title: Akoustis Announces First 5G Network Infrastructure Design Win with Tier-1 OEM
full_text: Akoustis Technologies, Inc. announced its first commercial design win for XBAW™ filters in 5G network infrastructure and first volume shipment to a tier-1 small cell customer in the March quarter.

title: Engalco Research Releases Latest Update of Report on mmWave Chipsets Into 5G Xhaul
full_text: Engalco Research released the latest update of its report on mmWave chipsets into 5G xhaul providing in-depth market data and analyses of this exciting and burgeoning communications segment. According to the firm’s senior researcher Terry Edwards, “mmWave links are already strategically important and we have found that strong market growth can be expected through most of this decade—globally.”

title: Keysight’s 5G Test Solutions Enable CTTL to Certify 5G Devices According to 3GPP Specifications
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced the company's 5G test solutions have been selected by China Telecommunication Technology Laboratory (CTTL) to certify 5G devices according to 5G new radio 3GPP specifications in both frequency range FR1 (frequency range from 450 to 6000 MHz) and FR2 (frequency range from 24250 to 52600 MHz).

title: SCF Releases 5G Functional API to Enable 5G RAN/Small Cell Vendor Ecosystem and Accelerate Deployment
full_text: To support the diverse mixture of 5G use cases, the Small Cell Forum (SCF) has published a suite of documents to enable small cells to be constructed piece-by-piece, using components from different suppliers.

title: AT&T Enhances Spectrum Position Following FCC Auction 103
full_text: AT&T Inc. was the winning bidder for spectrum licenses covering more than 99 percent of the U.S. population following the close of FCC Auction 103. The company’s winning bids will allow continued improvements and advancements to its wireless network.

title: ADRF Announces Windy City Wire as Preferred Distributor of Commercial and Public Safety Wireless Solutions
full_text: Advanced RF Technologies, Inc. (ADRF) announced that Windy City Wire (WCW) has become a preferred distributor of its in-building wireless solutions for commercial and public safety use cases. Per the agreement, WCW will only distribute ADRF distributed antenna system and repeater products to customers.

title: Laird Performance Materials Absorber Mitigates Signal Interference and Coupling Without Stressing Components
full_text: Laird Performance Materials has developed Softzorb MCS. This soft, conformable absorber eliminates unwanted signal noise while also acting as a gap filler that reduces coupling—all without damaging sensitive components.

title: Keysight Accelerates Development of Flexible Virtualized Networks and High-Value Mobile Services with NVIDIA
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced it is accelerating the development of flexible virtualized networks and high-value mobile services with NVIDIA. Keysight offers solutions that enable mobile operators and network equipment manufacturers to validate 5G and legacy radio access networks as well as core networks that are critical to ensuring the end-user experience of applications using vRAN architecture.

title: Keysight’s 5G Test Solutions Selected by DEKRA to Create Safety in Human Interaction with Tech Services
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced that DEKRA has selected Keysight's end-to-end test solutions to certify 5G new radio and vehicle-to-everything devices, in compliance with a wide range of requirements, to improve safety in human interaction with technology, including vehicles.

title: Anritsu Adds IQ Capture, Streaming Capability to Field Master Pro™ MS2090A RTSA
full_text: Anritsu Company introduced IQ capture and IQ streaming options for its Field Master Pro™ MS2090A that make the real time spectrum analyzer  the first handheld analyzer to capture 110 MHz of IQ data. When combining the new features with the best-in-class wide bandwidth, long memory and fast transfer speeds, the MS2090A can conduct comprehensive spectrum analysis in a variety of general purpose applications, including military intelligence and government regulations.

title: 5G’s Year One: Fast Start and Healthy Growth
full_text: Customers are making 5G the fastest growing generation of cellular wireless technology in terms of new subscriptions, according to 5G Americas. According to data based from Omdia, there are now over 17.7 million 5G connections globally as of Q4 2019, which represents 329 percent growth over Q3 2019—and is five million subscribers ahead of previous projections.

title: Rohde & Schwarz Presents New Test Solutions For 5G Base Stations
full_text: Rohde & Schwarz has extended its portfolio for generation and analysis of 5G signal waveforms. For 5G base stations, RF test solutions for the 5G frequency ranges FR1 (450 MHz to 7.125 GHz) and FR2 up to 44 GHz will be demonstrated.

title: World's First Commercial Adoption of 300 MHz 5G LampSite
full_text: China Unicom Beijing and Huawei have jointly completed the world's first commercial adoption of the 5G LampSite 300 MHz digital indoor system at the Beijing Long Distance Call Building. The system supports network sharing between China Unicom Beijing and China Telecom Beijing and provides a downlink perceived rate of up to 3.4 Gbps over a single headend in multi-user scenarios.

title: Qualcomm Continues to Make Headway Into What’s Next in 5G
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies sees 5G as the mobile innovation platform for this decade and beyond. That compels them to lead the 5G evolution, building upon the solid foundational technologies that were established in 3GPP Rel-15.

title: Frequency Matters, March 19: March Cable/Connector Supplement, News & Events
full_text: Microwave Journal editors Pat Hindle and Gary Lerude cover the March Cable and Connector supplement articles/products, 5G news and Satellite 2020 event in DC.

title: Keysight & VIOMI Collaborate to Accelerate 5G Enabled IoT Smart Home Product Market
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc. announced a collaboration with VIOMI to accelerate the market introduction of innovative 5G-enabled IoT devices for consumers in China.

title: Xilinx Tapped by Telefónica to Drive 5G Innovation Using Open RAN Standards
full_text: Telefónica has brought together Xilinx and a number of leading hardware and software companies in its quest to disrupt the market and accelerate the development of open radio-access network technologies in its 4G and 5G wireless networks.

title: Rohde & Schwarz Presents Cutting-Edge Conformance Testing Solution for 5G NR FR2
full_text: Rohde & Schwarz has developed a test solution able to perform the first tests for RF conformance in 3GPP FR2. The introduction of the new mmWave based FR2 frequency range for 5G and the increased use of active antennas without physical connectors requires testing to be performed over the air (OTA).

title: RFIC Start-Up MixComm Announces 28 GHz Beamforming Front-End IC
full_text: RFIC start-up MixComm has released its first production IC, an eight-channel RF front-end for 28 GHz, 5G phased array antenna systems. Sample quantities will be available during the second quarter of this year.

title: Taoglas and MixComm Announce 5G NR mmWave Smart Antenna Subsystem
full_text: Taoglas®and MixComm announced a technology partnership to co-develop a mmWave 5G NR smart antenna covering 26.5 to 29.5 GHz. The mmWave antenna subsystem will support small cells, repeaters and customer-premises equipment designs.

title: Richardson RFPD Announces Global Franchise Agreement with MixComm
full_text: Richardson RFPD, an Arrow Electronics company, announced that it has entered into a global franchise agreement with MixComm Inc., a New Jersey-headquartered start-up that bases its technology on RFSOI and mmWave breakthroughs.

title: Rohde & Schwarz Enables Sub-THz Ultra Wideband Signal Analysis
full_text: The Rohde & Schwarz setup represents some of the first research exploring data transmission at sub-THz frequencies featuring ultra-wide bandwidths. In the setup, a wideband-baseband signal is up-converted to the selected 140 GHz frequency via a R&S TC RSE converter box.

title: 3 Shiny New Tools in the 5G Toolbox
full_text: A few newer tools in the 5G toolbox that will be implemented this year and beyond will help enable the rollout of 5G networks include Integrated Access and Backhaul (IAB), Dynamic Spectrum Sharing (DSS) and Open Radio Access Network (O-RAN).

title: New Guidelines Released by the International Commission on Non‐Ionizing Radiation Protection
full_text: The International Commission on Non-Ionizing Radiation Protection (ICNIRP) released new guidelines for the protection of humans exposed to radio frequency electromagnetic fields. The guidelines cover the upcoming 5G technologies, as well as AM and DAB radio, WiFi, Bluetooth and the currently used 3G/4G mobile phones.

title: One Third of Mobile Operators Will Deploy 5G Standalone within Two Years
full_text: N/A

title: Innovation in Specialty Silicon Technology for 5G Front-End Modules
full_text: N/A

title: Rohde & Schwarz Present Signaling Test Solutions for 5G NR in FR1 and FR2
full_text: N/A

title: Renesas Electronics Unveils New High Performance Wideband mmWave Synthesizer
full_text: N/A

title: GSA: New 5G Phones Drive Total Announced 5G Devices Through 250 Barrier
full_text: Microwave Journal editors Pat Hindle and Gary Lerude cover the March Test & Measurement issue, 5G news, event status and special interview with Anokiwave's VP of Sales, Abhishek Kapoor.

title: Wireless Infrastructure RF Connector Market to Thrive as 5G Deploys
full_text: N/A

title: Verizon 5G Carrier Aggregation Trial Achieves Speeds of 4.2 gbps
full_text: N/A

title: Rakuten Mobile Selects Nokia for Optical Transport for Its First 5G Cloud-native Mobile Network
full_text: N/A

title: Norsat International Launches Enhanced 5G Interference Products to Mitigate Terrestrial Interference in C-Band
full_text: N/A

title: China Mobile Readies Round 2 of 5G Build
full_text: N/A

full_text: N/A

title: GSMA’s 2020 Mobile Economy Report Released
full_text: N/A

title: RFS Delivers 5G-Ready Antennas With Portfolio of ‘Building Block’ Equipment
full_text: N/A

title: Nokia and Marvell Enter Into Partnership on Silicon Technology for 5G
full_text: While the event will not take place this year, many companies were already touting their new products and demonstrations that would be on display. Therefore, Microwave Journal has collected these from the RF/microwave community and developed the summary here.

title: What You Would Have Seen at MWC 2020
full_text: Marvell and Analog Devices will collaborate to offer fully-integrated 5G digital front-end ASICs with tightly-coupled RF transceivers, developing next-generation radio solutions for a diverse set of functional splits and architectures.

title: Rohde & Schwarz and MediaTek Verify Dynamic Spectrum Sharing for 5G NR
full_text: Anokiwave's latest generation provides a complete RF signal chain solution for the 24/26, 28 and 37/39 GHz bands.

title: Keysight Works with Qualcomm Technologies to Accelerate Small Cell Deployment
full_text: N/A

title: Keysight Launches New Tools to Accelerate Performance Validation of 5G Devices
full_text: N/A

title: VIAVI Introduces Test Suite for O-RAN Specifications
full_text: N/A

title: 5G Available in 378 Cities Globally, According to VIAVI Report
full_text: N/A

title: Marvell and Analog Devices Announce Collaboration for Integrated 5G Radio Solutions
full_text: N/A

title: Ansys Launches RaptorH, Bringing the HFSS Solver Engine to Silicon Chip Design Teams
full_text: N/A

title: Anokiwave Announces Full Commercial Release of its 3rd-Generation 5G mmWave IC Family
full_text: N/A

title: Taoglas Announces Eight 5G NR Antennas
full_text: Antenna supplier Taoglas has announced eight 5G NR antenna designs to support emerging 5G applications, such as small cells, repeaters, industrial IoT and UAVs. The full range of Taoglas products, including its latest mmWave hybrid antenna array subsystem, is being displayed at the Embedded World conference in Nuremberg this week.

title: Fractus Antennas Launches the Smallest Antenna for 5G and Cellular IoT
full_text: The FRACTUS ANTENNAS team has announced a new antenna booster, ONE mXTEND™, a tiny antenna as small as a grain of rice covering select 2G, 3G, 4G and 5G frequency bands from 824 MHz to 5 GHz.

title: Frequency Matters Feb 20: Satellite/Radio Communications issue, Qualcomm news and MWC2020 Canceled
full_text: Microwave Journal editors Pat Hindle and Gary Lerude discuss the Feb Satellite & Communications issue products, Qualcomm news and MWC2020 cancellation issues.

title: Sivers IMA Develops 5G mmWave Beamformer ICs
full_text: Sivers IMA plans to begin sampling two beamformer ICs designed for the 24 and 28 GHz 5G bands. The RFICs integrate a pair of four-channel transmit and receive paths to support antenna arrays with horizontal and vertical polarization.

title: Qualcomm Introduces Third-Generation 5G Modem-RF System
full_text: Timed for the now-cancelled Mobile World Congress, Qualcomm Technologies announced its third-generation 5G modem-to-antenna solution, the Snapdragon X60. Samples will ship this quarter, which will support the commercial release of smartphones in early 2021.

title: Qualcomm Announces ultraSAW RF Filter Technology for Mobile Devices
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies has announced ultraSAW technology, a proprietary SAW filter technology for mobile front-ends from 600 MHz to 2.7 GHz. ultraSAW products are beginning production, and Qualcomm expects phones using the technology to be commercially available during the second half of 2020.

title: The Art and Science of 5G
full_text: Brent Dietz waxes poetic about the art of making a 5G antenna look like a tree — equally if not more impressive than the antenna pattern.

title: ZTE Releases Industry Unique SuperDSS Solution for Tri-RAT Dynamic Spectrum Sharing
full_text: ZTE Corporation, a major international provider of telecommunications, enterprise and consumer technology solutions for the Mobile Internet, today released its SuperDSS solution, the industry's unique solution for tri-RAT dynamic spectrum sharing. It is a big innovation step forward of the Magic Radio Pro solution in the 5G era to achieve multi-RAT spectrum sharing when legacy FDD bands are getting refarmed for 5G. Capable of dynamic spectrum sharing among both 2G/4G/5G and 3G/4G/5G, SuperDSS is an ideal way of fast 5G deployment and at the same time offering legacy voice service experiences over 1800MHz or 2100MHz band, so as to maximize spectrum return on investment.

title: VIAVI Introduces OneAdvisor, a Modular Test Platform to Simplify and Expedite Network Installation at Scale
full_text: Viavi Solutions Inc. launched OneAdvisor, a brand new instrument platform designed to address the evolving requirements of communication service providers, their field technicians and their contractors. As 5G becomes more ubiquitous in 2020 onward, network operators are aggressively scaling and commercializing this technology using large workforces of technicians or contractors to install and activate tens of thousands of cell sites. The first OneAdvisor solution, ONA-800, provides the essential combination of technology coverage, test features, and test process automation to facilitate this aggressive network deployment.

title: 5G Site Testing Solution from Rohde & Schwarz Bundles Test Tools for gNodeB Site Acceptance and Troubleshooting
full_text: With commercial 5G deployments gathering pace globally, field service teams are facing the challenge of successfully deploying and operating new network infrastructure that has a radically different architecture from previous cellular generations. Rohde & Schwarz has introduced the 5G Site Testing Solution (5G STS) that provides the industry with an integrated package of proven test equipment that combines all the necessary functional, RF and signaling tests for 5G installation and troubleshooting.

title: 5G: Crossing the Dreaded Trough of Disillusionment to the Plateau of Productivity
full_text: Anokiwave has expanded its San Diego operation to a new facility, tripling its floor space and lab capabilities and adding a mmWave lab with anechoic chamber for all active antenna and IC design and test.

title: Pillars of 5G: Spectral & Energy Efficiency
full_text: ZTE and the Sichuan Branch of China Telecom have enabled China’s first remote diagnosis of the coronavirus pneumonia using a 5G network. West China Hospital and Chengdu Public Health Clinic Center of Sichuan University performed the diagnosis.

title: Dielectric Resonator Antenna Arrays for 5G Wireless Communications
full_text: Microwave Journal editors Pat Hindle and Gary Lerude review the Feb Satellite and Radio Communications issue articles, 5G and acquisition news, and MWC2020 preview.

title: Breaking Down mmWave Barriers with Holographic Beam Forming®
full_text: Thomas L. Marzetta, a distinguished industry professor of electrical and computer engineering at the NYU Tandon School of Engineering and the director of the research center NYU WIRELESS, was elected to the National Academy of Engineering (NAE).

title: Anokiwave Expands in San Diego to Accommodate Growth
full_text: The Global mobile Suppliers Association (GSA) reported that the number of announced 5G devices has broken the 200 barrier for the first time. With 208 5G devices now announced from 78 vendors, the number of commercial devices has more than doubled in the last five months, having surpassed the milestone of 100 devices from 41 vendors in August 2019.

title: ZTE Helps China Telecom Realize China's First 5G Remote Diagnosis of New Coronavirus Pneumonia
full_text: N/A

title: Frequency Matters Feb 10, 2020: Satellite & Radio Communications issue, news and MWC2020
full_text: N/A

title: Timing Solutions for 5G Radio Synchronization
full_text: N/A

title: Thomas Marzetta Elected to the National Academy of Engineering
full_text: N/A

title: GSA: Number of 5G Devices Breaks 200 Barrier
full_text: N/A

title: Keysight Technologies to Showcase Test Solutions that Enable Customers to Test Tomorrow’s Technologies Today at MWC 2020
full_text: At Stand 6G30, Hall 6, Keysight will offer attendees the opportunity to speak with experts, connect with the industry ecosystem and discover innovative product solutions.

title: DuPont and SCHMID Announce Partnership for New PCB Plating Applications
full_text: DuPont Electronics & Imaging and SCHMID Group announce that they have entered into a nonexclusive joint development agreement to explore new PCB plating applications to bring advanced innovations to our global customers. The partnership will benefit high-end printed circuit board manufacturers by delivering next-generation interconnect products and metallization processes that can create faster, smarter and more reliable devices for the 5G era. The new solutions which will include equipment and chemistry are expected to be launched in late 2020.

title: Keysight, Samsung Collaborate to Validate Dynamic Spectrum Sharing Technology in Chipmaker’s New 5G Modem
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc., a leading technology company that helps enterprises, service providers and governments accelerate innovation to connect and secure the world, announced an extended collaboration with Samsung Electronics' LSI Business, a global leader in semiconductor components and 5G technology, to validate dynamic spectrum sharing (DSS) technology used in the smartphone maker's new 5G modem.

title: Akoustis Announces First Commercial Volume Order for 5G Infrastructure RF Filters
full_text: N/A

title: Rohde & Schwarz Validates First 5G RRM Conformance Tests with the R&S TS-RRM Test System
full_text: The Global Certification Forum GCF and PTCRB certification organization have accepted first test case validations in various FR1 and LTE band combinations using the new Rohde & Schwarz R&S TS RRM 5G radio resource management (RRM) conformance test system. The solution is the latest addition to a successful family of RRM conformance test systems.

title: Driven by connection: Rohde & Schwarz highlights leading T&M solutions for the mobile industry at MWC2020
full_text: Presenting its industry-leading solutions under the slogan “Driven by connection”, Rohde & Schwarz will be welcoming visitors at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona from February 24 to 27, 2020 in hall 6, Booth 6B30. The company will exhibit in an enlarged and newly designed show booth, covering not only various aspects of communications and connectivity, but also providing plenty of space for the visitors to connect and interact with the experts.

title: Wolfspeed Hampered By 5G and EV Softness, Huawei Export License Denial
full_text: Cree reported a disappointing quarter for its Wolfspeed business, which was hurt by delays in 5G infrastructure, the denial of an export license to Huawei and soft electric vehicle sales in China.

title: Qorvo Helping Validate mmWave in Handsets
full_text: Qorvo's mobile products segment is helping validate the use of mmWave in the handset, building prototypes to demonstrate the capability and assess the effects of thermal dissipation and power efficiency. Although multiple carriers have deploying mmWave, Eric Creviston, president of the mobile segment, said mmWave in the handset has not yet been proven.

title: New York City approves ConcealFab 5G Radio Shroud for Deployment
full_text: ConcealFab has collaborated with Radio Frequency Systems (RFS) to enable ConcealFab’s 5G Radio Concealment Shroud to efficiently package a sizable amount of 5G mmW radio equipment, 4G radios, and interconnection cables while ensuring optimal radio frequency (RF) performance. “Using RFS’s patented diplexers, which are the size of an apple, we have been able to accommodate the carrier’s equipment configurations within the stringent form-factor and size constraints of the DoITT shroud” stated ConcealFab Executive VP, Technical Fellow William “Doc” Pounds.

title: Apple Sets Record Revenue from iPhone, Wearables Demand
full_text: Apple reported record revenue and earnings for its December quarter, benefitting from strong demand for the iPhone 11, wearables and services. Apple said the iPhone had double-digit growth in mainland China.

title: Keysight Enables Major U.S. Mobile Operators to Accelerate 5G with Leading Number of 5G Device Test Cases
full_text: Keysight Technologies, Inc., a leading technology company that helps enterprises, service providers and governments accelerate innovation to connect and secure the world, announced that early engagements with all four U.S. mobile operators has resulted in more than 600 validated test cases, which are critical to the operators' respective 5G device acceptance plans, using Keysight's 5G network emulation solution suite.

title: Dynamic Spectrum Alliance Celebrates as CBRS Commercialization Becomes a Reality
full_text: Marking a new chapter in the spectrum-sharing success story of the Citizen’s Broadband Radio Service (CBRS), the Federal Communications Commission’s (FCC) full authorization of commercial deployment in the 3.5GHz band in the U.S. is an extremely important milestone in utilizing dynamic spectrum access for next-generation technologies, Dynamic Spectrum Alliance (DSA) President Martha Suarez said.

title: Skyworks Downplays mmWave Adoption for 5G
full_text: Skyworks doesn't see mmWave widely adopted in 5G handsets for at least the next year, according to Liam Griffin, CEO. “A lot of our customers are not looking at it right now.”

title: Comparison of US and UK Regulatory Approaches for Access to >100 GHz Spectrum
full_text: The past year has been a busy one for opening access to spectrum above 100 GHz.  On March 15, 2019 the US Federal Communications Commission (FCC) voted to allow access to spectrum above 100 GHz for the first time. Read this summary of where we are today with US and UK standards for over 100 GHz communications.

title: Advantech Wireless Technologies Announces Release of Specialized C-Band 5G Filter
full_text: Advantech Wireless Technologies has released a filter designed to prevent 5G base stations from interfering with C-Band satellite signals. The filter is available for immediate shipment.

title: Fear of Huawei Creating an International Digital Divide
full_text: U.S. fears that Huawei is an existential threat to the security of western democracies have precipitated a series of events building a digital divide, a divide separating the communications networks using Huawei equipment from those where it is shunned. A long-term resolution will require a broad cybersecurity agreement between the U.S. and China, one based on trust and verification.

title: Industrial IoT Networks Powered by 5G New Radio
full_text: 5G is entering uncharted territory. 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) Release 16 enables entirely new applications, expanding commercial mobile communications from familiar mobile broadband to the vast internet of things (IoT). 5G engineers stand before their greatest challenge yet: achieving the International Mobile Telecommunications 2020 (IMT-2020) vision for 10−5 reliability and 1 ms end-to-end latency. Will it be an engineering marriage made in hell or heaven? Part of the answer, like in marriage, is to find out what you are getting into.

title: Online Spotlight: NR and LTE Coexistence Through Dynamic Spectrum Sharing
full_text: The technology in today’s world continues to move higher in frequency to solve problems and improve performance. It is these millimeter wave (mmWave) frequencies that offer hope in solving the toughest requirements in many industries such as communications and defense. 5G communication systems benefit from years of research done by defense companies for different applications but similar needs.

title: ADI Introduces Wideband RF Transceiver to Simplify System Design and Reduce Costs
full_text: Analog Devices has introduced a new wideband transceiver within its RadioVerse™ design and technology ecosystem. The four-channel ADRV9026 is designed for base stations, including single and multi-standard 3G/4G/5G macrocell base stations, massive MIMO and small cells.

title: Ericsson Mobility Report 5G Subscriptions to Top 2.6B by 2025
full_text: Ericsson expects the global number of 5G subscriptions to top 2.6 billion within the next six years, driven by sustained momentum and a rapidly developing 5G ecosystem.

title: Teledyne e2v Unveils Multi-Channel ADC Supporting Up to 6.4 GSPS Operation
full_text: Teledyne e2v has released a 12-bit, quad-channel analog-to-digital converter (ADC). Bridging the gap between the analog RF and digital worlds, the EV12AQ605’s input bandwidth exceeds 6.5 GHz in the extended bandwidth mode. A variation on the company’s quad-core EV12AQ600 ADC, the EV12AQ605 signal conditioning solution offers almost identical functionality at a lower price, which will appeal to high volume, cost-sensitive markets.

title: Ericsson Mobility Report Highlights
full_text: Ericsson just released their Mobility Report and here are some highlights. Taking information directly from the report, more than 50 service providers around the world have launched commercial 5G services.

title: EMITE H-Series Test Platform Leads 5G Device OTA Test Market in US
full_text: After the approval of EMITE E-Series Test Platform by a major carrier for 4G OTA testing of devices a few years ago, the EMITE H-Series 5G OTA Test Platform has now been selected by the largest U.S. carrier for testing 5G devices over the air.

title: Global regulators at WRC-19 identify mmWave spectrum for 5G services
full_text: GSA (Global mobile Suppliers Association) is welcoming the decision today of the global spectrum regulators at the ITU’s World Radio Conference 2019 (WRC-19) to identify several millimeter wave frequency bands for 5G IMT.

title: Gigabit Internet Now Available to 1 in 20 People Globally
full_text: Research from VIAVI Solutions Inc. indicates that gigabit internet is now available to an estimated 354 million people across 51 countries, accounting for 5 percent, or 1 in 20, of the global population.

title: 5G: New Wave in the IoT Regime
full_text: IoT has been radically changing consumer and business landscape over the last few decades. The diverse set of connected devices from a range of verticals needs a unique communication infrastructure. The global 5G IoT market is in the nascent phase and expected to grow from USD 694 million in 2020 to USD 6,285.5 million by 2025, growing at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 55.4% during the forecast period. Read this article about emerging IoT use cases.

title: Keysight, Sprint Collaborate to Accelerate Commercial Deployment of 5G Technology
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that Sprint has selected Keysight's 5G network emulation solutions to validate the performance of 5G NR mobile devices, accelerating U.S. 5G commercial deployment of FWA and eMBB applications.

title: Carbon Nanotube Tech Exceeds 100 GHz for First Time in RF Applications
full_text: Carbonics announced that carbon nanotube technology has for the first time achieved speeds exceeding 100 GHz in RF applications, surpassing the performance of current RF CMOS technology.

title: Revolutionary Changes Ahead with Innovative 5G Uses
full_text: With 46 5G networks now deployed globally as of November 2019, 5G networks are expanding the value of wireless communications like never before.

title: Ericsson, Swisscom, Qualcomm Step Towards Nationwide 5G Coverage in Switzerland
full_text: An industry leading step in 5G has taken place in Switzerland on October 31 when the first over-the-air, Dynamic Spectrum Sharing (DSS) 5G data call was successfully carried out by Ericsson, Swisscom and Qualcomm Technologies Inc., a subsidiary of Qualcomm Inc.

title: Rohde & Schwarz Validates First 5G RF Conformance Tests with R&S TS8980
full_text: The GCF and PTCRB certification organization have accepted first test case validations in various FR1 and LTE band combinations using the new 5G RF conformance test system R&S TS8980FTA-3A from Rohde & Schwarz.

title: Siklu Announces the Terragraph Product Family
full_text: Siklu plans to accelerate the introduction of its Terragraph products, announced at Facebook’s TIP Summit ‘19 in Amsterdam. Siklu expects initial field trials during the first quarter of 2020, with commercial deployments by mid-year.

title: ZTE, China Telecom, China Unicom Lead in Completing 5G Co-Build Co-Share Verification
full_text: ZTE Corp., in partnership with China Telecom and China Unicom, has completed the network verification based on the co-build co-share mode in the commercial 5G environment, launching the world's first NSA co-build co-share sites of 1.8 G/2.1 G/3.5 G in Hangzhou, China.

title: The Phase Noise Challenge Pacing the Race to 5G
full_text: During MACOM’s earnings call yesterday, CEO Steve Daly reiterated MACOM’s commitment to GaN on Si technology, particularly for high volume, price sensitive, massive MIMO power amplifiers. He also said MACOM will design products with GaN on SiC, for higher power, higher frequency, military and satellite applications.

title: Keysight Enables Global Certification Forum to Certify 5G NR Mobile Devices
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced the company's 5G Protocol and RF/RRM & DVT conformance toolsets were used to submit 5G new radio (NR) non-standalone (NSA) and standalone (SA) test cases to the Global Certification Forum (GCF).

title: UNISOC Achieves 5G Data Call Over 5G mmWave Module
full_text: UNISOC announced that it has successfully completed a data call over 5G mmWave module based on the 26 GHz band.

title: 6G Research Gets Underway This Year
full_text: As 5G hits the first year of deployment from the first time initial commercial trials were started in the US by Verizon and AT&T, GSA is reporting that 50 commercial 5G networks have been deployed as China’s big three all activated 5G networks on Nov 1. Since most of the 3GPP 5G are in-process at this point so somewhat determined, several research activities have been announced for 6G.

title: Sony, NTT and Intel to Form 6G Partnership
full_text: Sony, NTT and Intel announced the companies will form a partnership to work on 6G mobile network technology, which is expected to be introduced around 2030.

title: Commerce Secretary: Some Huawei Licenses to be Issued “Shortly”
full_text: Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said the U.S. government will “shortly” issue licenses to allow some suppliers to ship some U.S. products to Huawei, although he cautioned that the export restrictions imposed in May presume any license application will be denied. Some 260 license applications have been submitted.

title: Wolfspeed’s Growth Hampered by 5G Push Out and EV Softness
full_text: Wolfspeed’s fiscal first quarter revenue was flat year-over-year and down 5 percent from the prior quarter, which parent Cree attributed to soft demand in China for electric vehicles (EV) and a push out of 5G, triggered by the U.S. banning exports to Huawei.

title: One Year of 5G Marks Watershed Moment for Industry
full_text: Friday, Nov 1 was a watershed moment for 5G as it marked about the first year of implementation and official launch of the 50th commercial 5G network according to the Global mobile Suppliers Association (GSA). This was reached by the switch on of services in China where China Unicom, China Mobile and China Telecom all went live on Friday.

title: China’s Big Three Operators Launch 5G
full_text: China’s three major mobile operators officially launched 5G services in parts of 50 cities, claiming the largest rollout in the world just six months after the government issued licenses.

title: Dynamic Spectrum Sharing is a Game Changer
full_text: Dynamic Spectrum Sharing (DSS) has emerged as a key part of mobile service providers’ 5G strategy at Mobile World Congress Los Angeles. DSS allows an existing LTE carrier to operate 5G NR and LTE simultaneously – with a simple software upgrade allowing a nice transition to 5G. This is especially critical in the low band where there are not a lot of users so dedicating just 5G usage there would be way too expensive to deploy.

title: Testing mmWave equipment for 5G applications
full_text: Engineers must be able to utilize test hardware, test sets and 5G waveform generation that can be used in tandem with high-bandwidth IQ waveforms. Additionally, RF transceivers must also undergo extensive testing. Find out how in this posting.

title: Intelligent Connectivity - 2019 MWC Los Angeles
full_text: Under the theme of Intelligent Connectivity, MWC19 Los Angeles showcased the convergence of Artificial Intelligence, IoT and Big Data enabled by 5G taking place Oct 22-24. This used to be CTIA but GSMA took it over recently so has re-branded it as MWC Los Angeles and they have MWC in Barcelona and Shanghai so cover the globe now with Barcelona being the marquee event.

title: ThinkRF Introduces 40 GHz RF Down-Converter for 5G
full_text: ThinkRF Corp. announced the new ThinkRF D4000 RF Downconverter.

title: NEL Releases 5G Ultra Low Phase Noise Multi Frequency Appliance
full_text: NEL Frequency Controls Inc. is pleased to announce the release of an all-new 5G appliance that uses GNSS GPS to synchronize radio transmitters over a wide geographic area, even worldwide.

title: GatorWings Wins DARPA Spectrum Collaboration Challenge
full_text: DARPA announced that GatorWings, a team of undergraduate students, Ph.D. candidates, and professors from the University of Florida are the winners of the Spectrum Collaboration Challenge (SC2) – a three-year competition to unlock the true potential of the radio frequency (RF) spectrum with artificial intelligence (AI).

title: Anritsu Intros 5G Protocol Test Functionality
full_text: Anritsu Co. has upgraded its Radio Communication Test Station MT8000A with 5G Protocol Test functions.

title: Field Measurements Confirm 5G Is Working
full_text: Signals Research Group, a consulting firm focused on the wireless industry, has been in the field testing the actual performance of 5G, measuring networks in Korea, Switzerland, the U.K. and the U.S., operating at 3.5 and 28 GHz. The company released a report of its findings this week, confirming that 5G is working.

title: Keysight Delivers High Performance PXE EMI Receiver
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. has extended the company's N9048B PXE Electromagnetic Interference (EMI) Receiver from 26.5 to 44 GHz enabling customers to meet current and emerging compliance testing requirements according to various standards bodies, including MIL-STD-461G and FCC Part 15.

title: ZTE Promotes Autonomous Driving with Commitment to Integrated C-V2X Solution
full_text: ZTE Corp. announced that it has participated in the “Four Layers” interoperability C-V2X Application Demonstration in Shanghai, China.

title: Antenna Co. Showcases Industry’s First DRA Array for 5G mmWave
full_text: Antenna Company announced that it will be showcasing the industry’s first 5G dielectric resonator phased antenna (DRA) array designed specifically for 5G mmWave applications.

title: Movandi, SOLiD and KT Leading Adoption of O-RAN Alliance mmWave Platforms
full_text: Movandi and KT Corp. announced they will jointly demonstrate an O-RAN (Open Radio Access Network) 5G mmWave radio unit (O-RU).

title: Sivers IMA and NXP Offer Antenna to Processor Solution for 5G FWA
full_text: NXP Semiconductors and Sivers IMA plan to offer integrated solutions for 5G, combining NXP’s Layerscape programmable baseband with Sivers IMA’s 5G New Radio (NR) RFICs and phased-array antennas, targeting applications such as fixed wireless access.

title: Movandi Joins O-RAN Alliance
full_text: Movandi has joined the O-RAN Alliance, an industry consortium formed to move the mobile network to a cloud-based, virtual system of open interfaces and compatible hardware and software from multiple manufacturers.

title: Verizon Approves Use of EMITE's OTA Platform for 5G Testing
full_text: Verizon Wireless has approved the use of EMITE H-Series CATR 5G CATR OTA Test Platform for its 5G NR RF OTA Test Plan. The approval comes after a three month laborious evaluation with other key players.

title: Qualcomm Announces Reference Design Integrating 5G and Wi-Fi 6, Providing Wireless Alternative to Cable, FTTH, DSL
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies announced a reference design for 5G-based fixed wireless access home gateways, which will enable mobile operators to offer broadband services that compete with cable, fiber to the home and DSL. Qualcomm’s reference design pairs the Snapdragon™ X55 5G Modem-RF System with the Networking Pro 1200 platform for Wi-Fi 6.

title: CommScope to Acquire Base Station Antenna Technology from Fractus
full_text: Fractus, a Spanish company that licenses antenna technology it has developed, will transfer its worldwide portfolio of base station antenna patents to CommScope, the outcome of a lawsuit filed by Fractus.

full_text: ZTE Corp., together with the Zhejiang Branch of China Telecom, assisted Bluetron in commissioning China's first 5G SA (standalone) site, which put 5G slicing, edge computing and smart manufacturing into trial to help Bluetron build a new 5G smart factory.

title: Siklu Announces EtherHaul™ ExtendMM™ 2-ft Dual-Band Antenna Now Available
full_text: Siklu announced the general availability of its new EtherHaul™ 2-ft (61 cm)  dual-band antenna (EH-ANT-2ft-DL5).

title: WIN Semiconductors Offering Sample Kit for 0.15 μm GaN on SiC Process

full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that the company's 5G conformance test solutions have been selected by Bureau Veritas for global 5G new radio (NR) device certification.

title: EMITE Finds Up to 5 dB Performance Differences in 5G Devices
full_text: A number of 5G devices have been benchmarked in two different continents with less than 0.5 dB STD differences.

full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that the company has established a joint 5G test laboratory in Shenzhen, China with OPPO further extending the collaboration between the two companies.

title: Keysight, Qualcomm to Accelerate Commercialization of Dynamic Spectrum Sharing Technology
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced an extended collaboration with Qualcomm Technologies Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Qualcomm Inc., to accelerate commercialization of Dynamic Spectrum Sharing (DSS) technology, which will enable mobile operators to quickly and cost-effectively roll out 5G new radio (NR) services.

full_text: Qualcomm switched its public narrative on 5G, turning its attention away from smartphones to focus on what it sees as a larger value opportunity in bringing the technology to new industries.
