full_text: Remcom announces participation in a whitepaper report on 5G mmWave frequencies and mobile networks recently published by The International Wireless Industry Consortium (IWPC).

title: Keysight, Tech Mahindra to Accelerate Adoption of 5G Devices Globally
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. and Tech Mahindra have announced an extended collaboration to support leading mobile operators achieve their goal of successfully deploying new 5G devices.

title: South Korea Hits 3M 5G Subs as Base Stations Double
full_text: South Korea surpassed the 3 million 5G subscriber mark on September 9, with coverage expected to reach 93 percent of the population by the end of the year.

title: Keysight Accelerates Market Introduction of 5G Devices in U.S.
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that the company's 5G network emulation solutions support the greatest number of 5G new radio (NR) test cases approved by PTCRB, enabling mobile device makers to efficiently accelerate 5G device certification.

title: 5G Network Rollouts Accelerate as LTE’s Long Tail Extends
full_text: Nearly a quarter billion new LTE connections were added around the world in the second quarter of 2019, according to 5G Americas and based on data from Ovum.

title: Cree Moves Fab Expansion to Upstate New York
full_text: Cree's previously announced $1 billion SiC and GaN wafer fab will be built in upstate New York, not North Carolina, after New York offered $500 million in incentives.

title: Prominent University Wireless Research Center Names New Director
full_text: NYU WIRELESS has appointed Thomas Marzetta–the originator of antenna technology that is enabling vast improvements in wireless communications–as director of the world-recognized research center at the NYU Tandon School of Engineering.

title: Ericsson Performs 5G Coverage/Performance Verification Using R&S Drone-Powered Solution
full_text: Rohde & Schwarz has supplied mobile network testing tools used in drone-based network coverage, performance and operation tests managed by Ericsson.

title: NYUSIM Version 2.0 Now Available
full_text: Three important channel modeling components, spatial consistency, human blockage, and outdoor-to-indoor (O2I) penetration loss, are implemented in NYUSIM 2.0.

title: Russian Telecom Giant & China’s Huawei Launch 5G Zone in Moscow
full_text: Russian mobile operator MTS has launched a 5G zone at VDNKh (All-Russian Exhibition Center), one of Moscow’s major attractions.

title: Qualcomm Acquires Remaining Interest in RF360 Joint Venture with TDK
full_text: Qualcomm announced today it has acquired the remaining 49 percent of the RF360 joint venture (JV) it began with TDK in 2017. The venture combined Qualcomm’s semiconductor technology with TDK’s acoustic filter capability, enabling Qualcomm to control a key component technology for the RF front-ends of mobile phones.

title: Progress in Opening Access to Spectrum above 100 GHz
full_text: While the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) Table of International Allocations and most national allocations tables have listed spectrum allocations up to 275 GHz, in reality specific policies for technologies above 100 GHz have been very rare until recently.

title: Siklu, BATS Wireless Addressing Challenges of 5G Backhaul "Siting Issues" in Municipalities
full_text: Siklu and BATS Wireless announced the successful testing of BATS’ OnPoint 5G antenna stabilization system with radio partner Siklu’s EtherHaul™ 8010FX, a high-throughput, mmWave wireless radio, ideal for 5G backhaul applications.

title: Qualcomm Sampling 5G mmWave Antenna Module for FWA CPEs
full_text: N/A

title: Avnet Accelerates Wireless Design with New RFSoC Development Kit
full_text: Avnet announced the availability of the Avnet RFSoC Development Kit using the Zynq UltraScale+ from Xilinx Inc., enabling system architects to explore the entire signal chain from antenna to digital.

title: 5G Americas Report Explores 5G’s Present and Future
full_text: 5G Americas announced the publication of "Global 5G: Implications of a Transformational Technology," a white paper produced by Rysavy Research and 5G Americas technical experts that explores the intensifying role of wireless communications, the evolution of its technology, emerging services and use cases, and a timeline of future developments through 2030.

title: WBA & NGMN Examine Options for Convergence, Management of Wi-Fi 6 & 5G
full_text: Mobile operators received further verification that Wi-Fi will play a critical role to the success of 5G, as illustrated in a new white paper developed by the Wireless Broadband Alliance (WBA) and the Next Generation Mobile Networks (NGMN) Alliance.

title: Rohde & Schwarz Validates 5G NR Protocol Conformance Tests with R&S CMX500
full_text: Rohde & Schwarz has carried out 5G NR protocol conformance testing with the new R&S CMX500 radio communication tester.

title: FCC Releases Draft Rules for CBRS Auction
full_text: Addressing the need for mid-band spectrum for 5G, the FCC released proposed rules for auctioning licenses in the Citizens Broadband Radio Service (CBRS) band, scheduled to begin on June 25, 2020. The FCC will officially act on the proposed rules at its next public meeting, on September 26.

title: Verizon 5G Goes Live in 13 NFL Stadiums in Time for Season Kickoff
full_text: As the NFL’s 100th season approaches, Verizon is preparing to bring its 5G Ultra Wideband service to 13 NFL stadiums, with additional deployments announced throughout the season.

title: Keysight Joins 5G Alliance for Connected Industries and Automation
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that the company has joined the 5G Alliance for Connected Industries and Automation (5G-ACIA) to help establish a framework for test and verification that will accelerate deployment of new industrial 5G use cases.

title: NGMN Reaches 5G Milestone with Recommendation of Common Cluster Connector
full_text: The Next Generation Mobile Networks (NGMN) Alliance announced a common RF cluster connector for early 5G deployment, aiming to minimize operating and maintenance costs for operators.

title: Telekom, HUBER+SUHNER Develop 5G-Capable Small Cell Antennas
full_text: Preparing its network for 5G, including the use of small cells, Deutsche Telekom has selected five small cell antennas developed by Huber+Suhner. The Sencity Urban antennas support 4G and 5G frequencies, covering the range from 1.7 to 4.2 GHz.

title: ZTE Teams with Smartfren to Further Indonesia’s 5G Capabilities
full_text: ZTE Corp. announced that it has partnered with Smartfren to support Ministry of Communication and Informatics of Indonesia to demonstrate the 5G applications in the manufacturing industry, in a bid to improve efficiency, workplace safety, as well as product accuracy and quality.

title: R&S Completes Industry’s First 5G LBS Session with Qualcomm
full_text: Rohde & Schwarz will enable handset manufacturers and mobile operators worldwide to test and verify LBS (Location Based Services) operation in 5G NR devices.

title: VIAVI Chosen to Test 5G for Brazilian Spectrum Auction
full_text: Viavi Solutions Inc. (VIAVI) announced it is working with Brazil’s national telecommunications agency (Agência Nacional de Telecomunicações, ANATEL) to evaluate and test 5G-suitable spectrum ahead of auctions that will take place in 2020.

title: Another Down Year for BTS Antenna-Radio Shipments Before 5G Kicks In
full_text: In his latest market report, analyst Earl Lum forecasts another down year for macro antenna and radio shipments, before 5G accelerates in 2020. initial sub-6 GHz 5G antenna radio systems will use traditional 8T8R remote radio units and passive antennas.

title: Qualcomm, Russian Mobile Operators to Enable Europe’s First 5G mmWave Network
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies Inc., a subsidiary of Qualcomm Inc., announced its work with the Department for Information Technologies of Moscow, Russian mobile operators, equipment and software vendors to support testing and deployment of Europe’s first 5G mmWave network in Moscow this fall.

title: Keysight Joins 6G Flagship Program to Advance Wireless Communications Research
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that the company has joined the multi-party 6G Flagship Program – supported by the Academy of Finland and led by the University of Oulu, Finland – as a co-creator to advance wireless communications research beyond 5G.

title: 5G Americas Reports Advanced Antenna Systems Supercharge 5G Capabilities
full_text: 5G Americas announced the publication of "Advanced Antenna Systems for 5G," a white paper that explores current trends in technology and spectrum enhancements for advanced antenna systems (AAS) that will improve 5G capabilities in data speeds, coverage and improved user experiences.

title: ZTE, China Mobile Empower China's First 5G Sporting Events with 5G Live TV Solutions
full_text: ZTE Corp. has announced that ZTE and the Shanxi Branch of China Mobile broadcast the 2nd National Youth Games of China with integrated 5G Live TV solutions.

title: 40 Gbps Wireless World Record for E-Band Communications at 11 km
full_text: DOK Ltd., ELVA’s manufacturing partner in Russia has reported on their website about deployment of 40 Gbps radio channel across the Yenisei River as wireless backup of Norilsk Nickel’s 40GE fiber channel backhaul.

title: South Korea Reaches 2M 5G Subscribers in 4 Months
full_text: The number of 5G subscribers in South Korea hit the 2 million mark this week, four months after local carriers commercially launched the technology, local press reported citing data from the industry.

title: Keysight Delivers Leading Number of 5G NR Protocol Conformance Test Cases Validated by GCF, PTCRB
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that the company's 5G network emulation solutions deliver a leading number of 5G new radio (NR) protocol conformance test cases validated by the Global Certification Forum (GCF) and PTCRB, a certification forum consisting of leading U.S. mobile operators.

title: Outlook Dims for Huawei and US Suppliers
full_text: The Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS) added 46 additional Huawei affiliates to the “entity list” today, meaning exporting products from the U.S. to any of these organizations and individuals requires an export license — with BIS warning the going-in presumption is that any license application will be denied. BIS also extended the temporary license provision by 90 days, allowing companies and consumers using Huawei equipment to find other options.

title: Skyworks Releases Front-End Module for WLAN and LAA
full_text: For smartphones and tablets, Skyworks Solutions has introduced an integrated front-end module for the 5 GHz Wi-Fi and licensed assisted access (LAA) protocols. The SKY855774-11 integrates a PA with a coupler at the output, an LNA that can be bypassed and a SPDT transmit/receive switch.

title: Using CDF to Assess 5G Antenna Directionality
full_text: FCC Chairman Ajit Pai has proposed the FCC maintain the existing health standards for exposure to RF radiation. The recommendation is supported by Jeffrey Shuren, Director of the Food and Drug Administration’s Center for Devices and Radiological Health.

title: FCC Chair Recommends No Change to RF Safety Standards
full_text: The GSA Research team have identified 100 announced 5G devices in total, excluding regional variants and prototypes not expected to be commercialised. This is a major milestone for the 5G device ecosystem.

title: GSA 5G Devices Ecosystem – August 2019 Update
full_text: N/A

title: Bits to Beams: Chipset for 5G mmWave Radio
full_text: N/A

title: A Traceable K Connector for 43.5 GHz Measurements
full_text: N/A

title: Digital Code Modulation MIMO Radar Improves Automotive Safety
full_text: N/A

title: R&S CMX500 Selected by Leading Quality Assurance Company
full_text: As 5G devices come to market, Intertek is ready to test 5G NR. The leading quality solutions provider to industries worldwide has chosen the new R&S CMX500 radio communication tester by Rohde & Schwarz as its 5G NR testing solution.

title: Anritsu Strengthens 5G NR PCT Leadership
full_text: Anritsu Corp. announced that the GCF has approved the highest number of 5G NR Protocol Conformance tests on the Anritsu 5G NR Mobile Device Test Platform ME7834NR at its CAG #59 meeting in July.

title: Qualcomm Introduces End-to-End OTA 5G mmWave Test Network in Europe
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies Inc., a subsidiary of Qualcomm Inc., announced an expansion of its 5G NR testing facilities in Europe to include a new lab dedicated to end-to-end over-the-air (OTA) configurations for 5G NR mmWave.

title: Huawei Takes Record 38% Share in China as Market Softens Before 5G Launch
full_text: Huawei surged ahead in China in Q2 2019 to achieve the highest market share for any vendor in eight years.

title: Verizon Plans Dynamic Spectrum Sharing for Sub-6 GHz 5G
full_text: During this week’s earnings call, Verizon CEO Hans Vestberg talked about Verizon’s sub-6 GHz spectrum plans, saying Verizon will use dynamic spectrum sharing (DSS) to host 5G and 4G on the same spectrum, eventually transitioning to 5G. This week, Verizon also announced its mobile, mmWave 5G service is available in parts of Atlanta, Detroit, Indianapolis and Washington DC.

title: AT&T and Uber Explore Advanced Communications with Drones
full_text: With the announcement that AT&T and Uber will explore how LTE and 5G connectivity can enhance next-generation electric vertical take-off and landing vehicles (eVTOLs) and cargo drones, see what AT&T had to say about the project with this interview.

title: 5G FWA to Enable Wireless Broadband Everywhere
full_text: The 5G FWA market is expected to grow from USD 0.4 billion in 2019 to USD 46.4 billion by 2026, growing at a CAGR of 97.5%.” Read this market overview.

title: Apple’s Q3 Story: It’s Getting Better
full_text: Apple reported fiscal Q3 revenue of $53.8 billion — just 1 percent year-over-year growth. All segments grew except for iPhone; its revenue was down 12 percent from last year's quarter. CEO Tim Cook said that was an improvement over the 17 percent year-over-year decline in Q2.

title: Microlease Eases Access to 5G Test
full_text: Microlease, now part of Electro Rent Corp., continues to make significant investments in test equipment for the emerging 5G mobile communications standard.

title: Keysight Supports Leading Number of GCF Validated 5G NR Conformance RF Test Case
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that following the Conformance Agreement Group (CAG) #59 meeting last week, Keysight now supports a leading number of 5G new radio (NR) conformance RF test cases validated by the Global Certification Forum (GCF).

title: Anritsu Solution First to Receive GCF 5G NR mmWave Conformance Test Certification
full_text: Anritsu Corp. President Hirokazu Hamada is pleased to announce that its New Radio RF Conformance System ME7873NR has achieved industry-first Global Certification Forum (GCF) validation for 5G New Radio (NR) mmWave RF conformance tests based on 3GPP specifications.

title: AT&T Plans Nationwide 5G Coverage During 2020 — at 700 MHz
full_text: AT&T plans to have nationwide 5G coverage by the first half of 2020, using the 700 MHz FirstNet public safety network it is building. With limited handsets and coverage, 5G in the mmWave bands will initially be marketed to business customers.

title: Anritsu, ETS-Lindgren Launch 5G NR OTA Solution
full_text: Anritsu Co. and ETS-Lindgren continue their successful long-term collaboration in cellular and short-range technologies with the integration of Anritsu’s Radio Communication Test Station MT8000A for 5G OTA testing with the ETS-Lindgren EMQuest EMQ-100 Antenna Measurement Software.

title: Forecast: Global Macrocell Baseband Shipments to Grow 11% in 2019
full_text: EJL Wireless Research says shipments of digital baseband units (BBU) declined 23 percent in 2018 compared to 2017, the first decline in six years. However, the firm forecasts net BBU shipment growth of 11 percent in 2019, consisting of a modest 6 percent for LTE BBU shipments and greater than a 10x increase for 5G NR BBU shipments.

title: Keysight's 5G Test Solutions Selected by Fibocom
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that Fibocom Wireless Inc. has selected the company's 5G network emulation solutions to accelerate development and validation of 5G new radio (NR) modules for the PC market.

title: Small Cell Forum Publishes Specification to Drive Unified 5G Open RAN
full_text: Small Cell Forum (SCF) has published the PHY API for 5G to stimulate a competitive ecosystem for vendors of 5G small cell hardware, software and equipment.

title: T-Mobile, Qualcomm, Ericsson Closer to Delivering Broad 5G on Low-Band Spectrum
full_text: T-Mobile, Qualcomm Technologies Inc., a subsidiary of Qualcomm Inc., and Ericsson announced they have achieved the world’s first low-band 5G data session on a commercial 5G modem.

title: GSA Confirms Record 26 5G Devices Announced in June, Total 90 Globally
full_text: The Global mobile Suppliers Association (GSA) confirmed that the number of announced 5G devices has more than doubled in the last three months, with 26 new devices added in June alone.

title: R&S, Marvin Test Solutions Create Turnkey Production Tester for 5G Beamforming ICs
full_text: T&M companies Rohde & Schwarz and Marvin Test Solutions have cooperated to create a unique turnkey solution suited for testing the beamforming ICs used in mmWave 5G and SatCom systems.

title: ZTE Axon 10 Pro 5G, First 5G Smartphone Sold in Nordic Countries
full_text: ZTE Corp., partner of Elisa, officially sold the first 5G smartphone ZTE Axon 10 Pro 5G in Finland.

title: Microwave Will Drive the Development of 5G
full_text: Anritsu Co. introduces a Log Import option to strengthen the IMS evaluation functions of its Signalling Tester MD8475B base station simulator.

title: Anritsu Adds IMS Evaluation Functions to MD8475B
full_text: Adding to its 5G portfolio, Skyworks has introduced an antenna aperture tuning switch, the SKY5™−9269-702LF, a SP4T switch covering 600 MHz to 6 GHz designed for LTE Advanced Pro and 5G mobile platforms.

title: Skyworks' Latest 5G Antenna Tuning Solution
full_text: At MWC Shanghai 2019, Canalys released its latest worldwide forecasts for 5G smartphones.

title: Canalys: 1.9B 5G Smartphones Will Ship in Next 5 Years, Overtaking 4G
full_text: EJL Wireless Research has published a case study for Verizon’s initial 5G mmWave network deployment in Minneapolis. Earl Lum, principal analyst of EJL Wireless, surveyed a limited number of sites in the downtown and surrounding areas, identifying "serious issues regarding the deployment of 5G mmWave small cells."

title: Report Analyzes Verizon’s 5G Mobile Network in Minneapolis
full_text: Leti, a research institute of CEA Tech, and Radiall announced a five-year common lab to design innovative antennas, RF to meet infrastructure requirements of 5G networks and photonics components for harsh environments.

title: CEA-Leti, Radiall to Design Innovative RF Components for 5G Networks, Photonics Components
full_text: Taoglas announced an addition to their hugely successful Warrior series, the PA740 antenna, at the 2019 MWC Shanghai.

title: Taoglas Cellular Antennas Include Latest LTE, 5G Bands for Global Deployments
full_text: Rogers Corp. now offers RO4730G3™ UL 94 V-0 antenna-grade laminates manufactured with standard profile electrodeposited copper foil to meet present and future performance requirements in active antenna arrays and small cells, notably in IoT applications as well as emerging 5G wireless systems.

title: Rogers Corp. Offers Alternative Copper Option for RO4730G3 Laminates
full_text: 5G, using 3GPP standardized wireless technology, has been commercially deployed by 15 mobile network operators worldwide, according to 5G Americas, the industry trade association and voice of 5G and LTE for the Americas and TeleGeography (GlobalComms Database).

title: 5G Live! 15 Commercial Standardized 5G Networks Worldwide
full_text: Ericsson plans to build a “fully automated smart factory” in the U.S. to manufacture advanced antenna systems and small cell radios for 5G. The new facility will begin operations in early 2020.

title: Ericsson Building US “Smart Factory” for 5G Radios
full_text: N/A

title: China Mobile Unveils 5G Target, $4.4B Investment Plan
full_text: China Mobile announced it would rollout commercial 5G services in 50 cities by the end of the year and set-up a CNY30 billion ($4.4 billion) industry fund, as it detailed its strategy for the new network technology.

title: ZTE Secures Over 25 5G Commercial Contracts
full_text: ZTE Corp. announced that it has secured over 25 5G commercial contracts globally and has been already committed to partnerships in the 5G arena with over 60 operators across the globe.

title: Industry Chat: Earl Lum on Verizon 5G, Sprint/T-Mobile, Huawei and IMS2019
full_text: In our latest industry chat, market analyst Earl Lum and I sat down to compare notes about the wireless industry and what caught our attention at #IMS2019. Listen to our conversation on this episode of the Microwave Journal podcast.

title: Siklu Delivers Wireless Public Safety Video Network for Cambridge, Ontario
full_text: Siklu announced that its radios have been deployed in the City of Cambridge, located roughly 100 km West of Toronto in Ontario, to provide outdoor video security and support potential public Wi-Fi network services.

title: SaT5G Project Announces Successful Demos of 5G Over Satellite at EuCNC 2019
full_text: The SaT5G project announced the operation of a number of successful demonstrations of 5G over satellite at the 2019 European Conference on Networks and Communications (EuCNC 2019) in Valencia, Spain.

title: ZTE, Telefonica, Bank of Santander Announce Europe’s First 5G Banking Services in Spain
full_text: ZTE Corp. announced that it has partnered with Telefonica and Bank of Santander to announce Europe’s first banking services in Spain.

title: u-blox Redefines IoT Security with 5G-Ready Cellular Module and Chipset
full_text: u-blox has announced the SARA-R5 series of LTE-M and NB-IoT modules for low power wide area (LPWA) IoT applications, its most advanced, secure and highly integrated cellular product.

title: Mobile Experts Releases Fresh Forecast for RF Front-Ends Including mmWave
full_text: As detailed in a new report from Mobile Experts, the mmWave market for RF front-end components will grow to more than $1 billion by 2024, driven by smartphones, hotspots and fixed customer premises equipment.

title: ADI's Multi-Channel, Mixed-Signal RF Converter Platform Expands Call Capacity, Data Throughput
full_text: Analog Devices Inc. (ADI) introduced a mixed-signal front-end (MxFE™) RF data converter platform that combines high-performance analog and digital signal processing for a range of wireless equipment such as 4G LTE and 5G mmWave radios.

title: NGMN and ESOA Sign Cooperation Agreement
full_text: The EMEA Satellite Operators Association (ESOA) and the Next Generation Mobile Networks Alliance (NGMN) have signed a cooperation agreement to strengthen their relationship and foster integration of satellite solutions into the 5G ecosystem.

title: Huawei Export Ban Hits Wolfspeed
full_text: N/A

title: Integrated 140 GHz FMCW Radar for Vital Sign Monitoring and Gesture Recognition
full_text: Viavi Solutions Inc. announced that the VIAVI TeraVM 5G testing solution supports standalone (SA) specifications according to the latest 3GPP standards, in addition to non-standalone (NSA) mode.

title: VIAVI Unveils 5G SA Testing Capability for Network Technology Validation Solution
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that the company's new Modulation Distortion Analysis test suite has enabled Qorvo to fully characterize 5G mmWave front end module (FEM) performance in production test.

title: Keysight's Modulation Distortion Analysis Test Solution Enables Qorvo to Fully Characterize 5G mmWave FEM in Production Test
full_text: pSemi announced the release of UltraCMOS® 13, the next-generation of its proprietary RFSOI process running on GlobalFoundries’ 300 mm wafer fab. UltraCMOS 13 was tailored to improve low noise amplifier (LNA) and power amplifier (PA) performance and enable improved performance from integrated front-end components.

title: pSemi Corp. Announces Next Generation UltraCMOS® Technology
full_text: Laird Connectivity has announced the CMD69423P, an indoor MIMO ceiling mount antenna, suitable for 5G deployments, that delivers best-in-class performance with low-profile aesthetics.

title: Laird Connectivity Develops MIMO Antenna for 5G Applications
full_text: Canalys released its updated global smartphone forecasts. The latest numbers show that smartphone shipments will reach 1.35 billion units in 2019, a year-on-year decline of 3.1 percent.

title: Smartphone Shipment Forecast Cut to 1.35B for 2019 as Uncertainty Prevails
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced the company's 5G Conformance Toolset was first to submit 5G NR NSA RF test cases for PTCRB validation approval in FR2, as well as for 5G NR SA protocol test cases in FR1, accelerating market introduction of 5G NR mobile devices.

title: Keysight Strengthens Position in PTCRB, Accelerating 5G NR Device U.S. Certification
full_text: The FCC announced the winners of the 28 and 24 GHz Spectrum Frontiers auctions, (known as auctions 101 and 102) on Monday, June 3. Not surprisingly, Verizon took most of the 28 GHz licenses. At 24 GHz, AT&T and T-Mobile fought for the best position.

title: FCC Announces Winners of 24 and 28 GHz Auctions
full_text: Kumu Networks announced immediate commercial availability of an evaluation board for its KU1500 Canceller RFIC.

title: Kumu Networks Announces KU1500 RFIC Evaluation Board Availability
full_text: N/A

title: Anokiwave Portfolio of 24/26 GHz ICs for 5G on Showcase at IMS2019
full_text: As the commercial launch of 5G services rapidly approaches and with the U.S. FCC Auction 102 (24 GHz Band) just completing –raising over $2 billion, Anokiwave is showcasing its portfolio of 24/26 GHz ICs for 5G applications at IMS2019 in Boston, Mass.

title: ADI Breakthrough Solution to Accelerate mmWave 5G Wireless Network Infrastructure
full_text: Analog Devices, Inc. (ADI) introduced a new solution for mmWave 5G with the highest available level of integration to reduce design requirements and complexity in the next generation of cellular network infrastructure.

title: FCC Completes 24 and 28 GHz Auctions
full_text: The FCC announced the conclusion of the 24 GHz “Spectrum Frontiers” auction, which raised $2.0 billion for 2,904 of the 2,909 licenses offered. This follows a similar auction of 28 GHz spectrum, which concluded on January 24 (2019) and raised $702 million for 2,965 of the 3,072 licenses offered. The winners of both auctions will be announced within a few days.

title: SoftBank Corp. Selects Nokia for 5G
full_text: SoftBank Corp. has selected Nokia as a strategic partner to drive its commercial 5G offering with the Nokia AirScale solution. The rollout of Nokia's 5G AirScale will allow the telco to meet growing consumer and industrial demands for 5G.

title: EE to Launch Commercial 5G in 6 UK Cities on May 30
full_text: U.K. operator EE has confirmed that it will launch commercial 5G services on May 30.

title: Keysight, Nokia Launch OpenTAP™ for Accelerating Software Development
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc., in conjunction with Nokia, announced the launch of the Open Test Automation Project (OpenTAP).

title: Korean Mobile Operator Selects Anritsu Field Master Pro™ MS2090A to Test World’s First 5G Network
full_text: Anritsu Co. announces that South Korea’s leading mobile operator, KT Corp., has selected the new Anritsu Field Master Pro™ MS2090A RF handheld spectrum analyzer to test the world’s first 5G nationwide network in the sub-6 GHz band.

title: HUBER+SUHNER Launches Outdoor MIMO Antennas to Ease Urban 5G Deployments
full_text: HUBER+SUHNER has launched two 2 x 2 MIMO, compact outdoor antennas for 4G and 5G small cells.

title: Accelerating Carrier Acceptance Testing for 5G Devices
full_text: The 5G market represents a significant opportunity for device manufacturers, particularly for smartphones. Jumpstarting device acceptance testing in the labs of device manufacturers is easier said than done, though. Solutions exist that address the challenges, including leveraging developed and flexible conformance test solutions, network emulation and power analyzers and virtual drive testing.

title: Keysight Launches Next Generation Integrated Network Analyzers
full_text: Keysight Technologies has launched its next-generation network analyzers, available now in benchtop, USB and PXI form factors. This new generation delivers reliability and repeatability with best-in-class dynamic range, trace noise, temperature stability and a wide range of software applications enabling engineers to fully characterize devices.

title: NI, Tokyo Electron, FormFactor, Reid-Ashman Demo 5G mmWave Semiconductor Wafer Probe Test Solution at NIWeek 2019
full_text: NI announced and demonstrated a 5G mmWave wafer probe test solution it developed in collaboration with Tokyo Electron, FormFactor and Reid-Ashman.

title: Anokiwave Portfolio of 37/39 GHz ICs for 5G on Showcase at IMS2019
full_text: As the commercial launch of 5G services rapidly approaches and in anticipation of the 37/39 GHz U.S. FCC auction later this year, Anokiwave is showcasing its portfolio of 37/39 GHz  ICs for 5G applications at IMS2019 in Boston, Mass.

title: NI Introduces mmWave Test Solution to Accelerate Race to 5G Commercialization
full_text: NI announced the mmWave Vector Signal Transceiver (VST) to address the test challenges of 5G mmWave RFIC transceivers and power amplifiers.

title: Commerce Move to Allow Limited Exports to Huawei Not Much Help for Suppliers
full_text: The U.S. Commerce Department is granting limited exceptions to the export ban imposed on Huawei. Aimed at mobile operators using Huawei equipment and owners of Huawei phones, the 90-day reprieve is not a lifeline for U.S. component suppliers. Most interesting, the exception allows Huawei to continue to engage in 5G standards development through recognized standards bodies.

title: Huawei Export Ban Hits Qorvo: $50M Revenue Drop This Quarter
full_text: Qorvo said the export ban on Huawei is expected to reduce this quarter's revenue by some $50 million. For the most recent fiscal year, which ended March 30, Huawei contributed 15 percent of Qorvo's total revenue, approximately $469 million.

title: Deutsche Telekom, Ericsson Top 100 Gbps Over Microwave Link
full_text: Ericsson and Deutsche Telekom have achieved a landmark data transmission rate by consistently topping 100 Gbps in a trial microwave link over 1.5 km.

title: Steve Daly Replaces John Croteau as MACOM President and CEO
full_text: In an unexpected move, MACOM announced this morning that Stephen Daly has replaced John Croteau as president and CEO. Daly is a member of MACOM’s board and previously served as president, CEO and chairman of Hittite. MACOM did not disclose what prompted the change, saying only that Croteau resigned May 15 and will serve in an advisory role for the next two months, to assist with the leadership transition.

title: UMS Contributes to the French Nano 2022 Program
full_text: As part of the French Nano 2022 public-private program, UMS and several French partners will develop “smart RF solutions,” new integration technologies for systems in package (SiP).

full_text: Rohde & Schwarz and MediaTek have successfully conducted 5G signaling tests using a device equipped with MediaTek's new Helio M70 5G modem, ensuring the modem is compatible and ready for 5G NR deployment.

full_text: Verizon just revealed a one-two punch: opening up preorders for the Galaxy S10 5G and announcing a list of 20 cities that will be getting the technology before year’s end.

title: RFS Launches 5G-Ready Dual Band Microwave Antennas as Alternative to Fibre Backhaul
full_text: Radio Frequency Systems (RFS) announces it is first to market with its family of innovative dual-band microwave antennas.

title: Wolfspeed Scrambling to Add GaN RF Capacity to Support 5G Demand
full_text: Wolfspeed's revenue grew 72 percent year-over-year in Q3, accompanied by improved gross margin. However, 5G demand for the company's GaN transistors has exceeded capacity, and Cree CEO Gregg Lowe says it will take a few quarters to add the needed capacity to catch up.

title: Keysight Accelerates AAC's Introduction of High Performance 5G mmWave Front-End Solutions
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that AAC Technologies (AAC) used Keysight’s suite of 5G solutions to introduce high performance 5G mmWave front-end solutions for next-generation mobile phones and base stations.

title: Apple Reports Fiscal Q2 Results, Sees iPhone Demand in China Improving
full_text: Strong demand for Apple’s services, iPad, wearables and Mac computers wasn’t sufficient to offset weakness in iPhone sales, leading to a net 5 percent year-over-year (Y/Y) decline in revenue in the company’s second fiscal quarter (Q2). However, CEO Tim Cook expressed a positive outlook for iPhone sales in China, the world’s biggest cellular market.

title: Brooklyn 5G Summit 2019 Sees Watershed Moment with 5G
full_text: The Brooklyn 5G Summit attracts almost all of the leaders in 5G research and development as the premier 5G annual event is hosted by NYUWIRELESS and Nokia on the NYU Campus. Leaders from both the operators and equipment manufacturers all attend and present their latest results and thoughts on the direction of the industry.

title: Huawei Says It Has Launched World's First 5G Auto Hardware
full_text: China's Huawei Technologies launched on Monday what it said was the world's first 5G communications hardware for the automotive industry, in a sign of its growing ambitions to become a key supplier to the sector for self-driving technology.

title: Watershed Moment for Wireless: Brooklyn Summit Looks at 5G and Beyond
full_text: The sixth annual Brooklyn 5G Summit at New York University’s Tandon School of Engineering comes at a linchpin moment.

title: Qualcomm Using Anritsu Solution for 5G Testing
full_text: Anritsu Corp. announces that Qualcomm Technologies Inc., a subsidiary of Qualcomm Inc., has accepted Anritsu’s Radio Communication Test Station MT8000A and CATR Anechoic Chamber MA8172A as a validated test method to conduct 5G measurements.

title: MACOM and Goertek Forming JV to Chase China’s 5G Build Out
full_text: MACOM and Goertek, a $2 billion dollar Chinese electronic components manufacturer, are forming a joint venture (JV) company to market and distribute MACOM’s GaN on Si RF power amplifiers to China’s base station market.

title: Keysight’s 5G Test Solutions to Accelerate Commercialization of IIoT, Mobile Broadband and FWA
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced the company's 5G network emulation solutions have been selected by Quectel to accelerate commercialization of industrial IoT (IIoT), mobile broadband and fixed wireless access (FWA) applications.

full_text: Rohde & Schwarz completes its commercial 5G NR network measurement solution.

title: Ericsson and Swisscom in European Commercial 5G First
full_text: Ericsson and Swisscom have switched on the first large-scale commercial 5G network in Europe supporting commercially available smartphones. The 5G network and related services are available in 54 cities and communities in Switzerland, including the major population areas: Zürich, Bern, Geneva, Basel, Lausanne and Lucerne.

title: Keysight Accelerates Global Certification of 5G Devices with 5G NR Conformance Test Case Leadership
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced the company's 5G Conformance Toolset now supports the greatest number of validated GCF and PTCRB protocol, as well as RF conformance test cases, for both 5G NR NSA and SA mode, as reaffirmed at the recent GCF meeting.

title: Intel Gives Up on 5G Modems While Qualcomm Scores Big with Apple
full_text: On April 16, 2019, Apple and Qualcomm settled their bitter legal battle just one day after opening arguments were exchanged in a US Federal court. On a momentous day, Intel also announced its intention to exit the smartphone cellular modem market. Read this analysis of the resulting market outlook for these companies and others affected by the settlement.

title: Skyworks Launches Custom Circulators for 5G Infrastructure
full_text: Skyworks Solutions has announced two small circulators for the 3.5 GHz 5G infrastructure band. The two are available in 7 and 10 mm surface-mount packages, respectively, supporting the size requirements of small cell and massive MIMO systems.

title: R&S and OPPO Carry Out 5G NR FR1 Signaling Test
full_text: Rohde & Schwarz and electronics manufacturer OPPO have performed a non-standalone 5G NR FR1 signaling test.

title: Keysight Provides 5G NR Mobile Device Conformance Test Solutions to NTT DOCOMO
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that Keysight's 5G Conformance Toolset, part of Keysight's 5G network emulation solution portfolio, has been selected by NTT DOCOMO INC to ensure 5G new radio (NR) mobile devices comply to the latest 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) standards prior to market introduction of new 5G services.

title: ZTE, China Mobile Take the Lead in HD Voice/Video Calls between 5G/4G Smartphones
full_text: ZTE Corp. announced that ZTE, Guangzhou Branch of China Mobile and Ericsson have taken the lead in making a VoLTE voice and video call between 5G and 4G smartphones, marking a great step forward in the commercialization of 5G network and smartphone.

title: Keysight, Telia Collaborate to Accelerate Commercial 5G NR Deployment
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced a collaboration with Telia Finland to accelerate commercial 5G New Radio (NR) deployments.

title: Qualcomm, Swisscom Bring 5G to Europe with First-Announced Commercial Services
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies Inc., a subsidiary of Qualcomm Inc., and Swisscom, together with cutting-edge device manufactures including OPPO, LG Electronics, Askey and WNC, announced the arrival of commercial 5G services in Europe with the launch of Swisscom’s 5G network.

title: New R&S Spectrum Analyzers Ideal for 5G NR
full_text: Rohde & Schwarz is launching two signal and spectrum analyzer families, with different frequency models covering up to 44 GHz.

title: IDTechEx Research Asks if 5G is Slowing Down in China
full_text: N/A

title: SK Telecom Launches Nationwide 5G Services in Korea
full_text: Korean carrier SK Telecom has officially launched commercial 5G services across the country, the telco said in a statement.

title: Keysight Enables Activation of GCF Certification for 5G NR SA Mobile Devices
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced the company's 5G RF Conformance Toolset was used to submit 5G new radio (NR) standalone (SA) test cases to the Global Certification Forum (GCF), enabling the independent certification body to activate certification of 5G NR SA mobile devices based on 3GPP standards.

title: PAWR Program Produces Nation’s First Open, Programmable Advanced Wireless Research Testbed
full_text: The PAWR program, funded by the NSF and a consortium of 29 industry partners, announced the completion of the first phase of deployment of an advanced wireless research testbed with end-to-end programmability of radio and edge compute resources in Salt Lake City, Utah.

title: Keysight, Qualcomm Establish Industry's First Announced 5G NR Data Call in FDD Mode
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that the company, together with Qualcomm Technologies Inc. has established the mobile industry's first announced 5G NR data call in the FDD mode, accelerating global deployments in all major 3GPP frequency bands including TDD and FDD.

title: Qualcomm Works to Kickstart 5G for IIoT with Live Ecosystem Demos
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies Inc. announced demonstrations of IIoT applications with multiple companies at Hannover Messe using a live OTA 5G NR network utilizing mobile test devices powered by the Qualcomm® Snapdragon™ X50 5G modem and antenna modules with integrated RF transceiver, RF front-end and antenna elements.

title: Ericsson and Nokia Both Have 16 Public 5G Wins
full_text: With first-blush services turned up in the U.S. and a few other key global markets, operators are planning to scale out 5G networks throughout 2019.

title: Fractus Antennas Components Available within NI AWR Software
full_text: Fractus Antennas’ Virtual Antenna™ components will be available within NI AWR software beginning in April (2019).

title: GSA Launches First Global Database of Commercial 5G Devices
full_text: The Global mobile Suppliers Association (GSA) has released the industry’s first database tracking 5G device launches globally.

title: RFS’ Modular Active Passive Antenna Addresses Challenges of 5G Evolution
full_text: Radio Frequency Systems (RFS) announces its Active Passive Antenna (APA) that is designed for the real world challenges of 5G rollouts.

title: 5G Tester Market is Expected to Take in $629M in 2019
full_text: Nearly 75 thousand 5G testers were sold in 2018. According to a recent intelligence report presented by Future Market Insights (FMI), the sales volume of 5G tester will thrive impressively at around 14 percent in 2019.

title: More Than 600K 5G mmWave Radio Units to Ship Through 2025
full_text: The world has a massive appetite for mobile data, especially in crowded cities. Operators are going to have to make their loaves and fishes feed everybody—but how? In a brand new report, Mobile Experts reveals how they expect operators to satisfy the hunger for more data, with new networks at 24 to 39 GHz.

title: Network Tester Market Will Hit 14.8% CAGR by 2027
full_text: Network tester market is likely to witness more than 12.5 percent Y-o-Y in 2019, after registering the global revenue roughly equating $7 billion in 2018, according to a study of Future Market Insights (FMI).

title: The 5G revolution is pushing innovations for RF front-end SiP
full_text: Yole Développement (Yole) has just released a report showing an industry shift in packaging technology as 5G is implemented. They state that 5G will totally redefine how the RF front-end interacts in-between the network and the modem. The new RF bands for sub 6 GHz pose big challenges for the industry.

title: Ericsson, Telia and Volvo CE Team Up on 5G for Industrial Use
full_text: Ericsson, Volvo Construction Equipment (CE) and Telia are operating Sweden’s first 5G network for industrial use, placing Volvo CE among the early global pioneers to test remote-controlled machines and autonomous solutions with the technology.

title: First Field Instrument with 5G NR 3D Coverage Mapping Introduced by Anritsu
full_text: Anritsu and TRX Systems  have introduced a field solution providing 3D indoor and outdoor coverage mapping for 5G NR. It integrates Anritsu's Field Master Pro™ MS2090A RF handheld spectrum analyzer with the TRX MA8100A NEON Signal Mapper.

title: Verizon Announces 5G Mobile Service
full_text: Verizon plans to launch its 5G mobile service in Chicago and Minneapolis on April 11, the first locations to have Verizon’s NR compliant 5G. Consumers can access the network with the moto 5G mod paired with the moto z3 4G handset.

title: Improved EM Simulation of 5G mmWave Arrays
full_text: Every year at the end February, we make our annual pilgrimage to Barcelona, Spain for the world’s largest wireless conference, the Mobile World Congress.  The shear scale of the conference can be overwhelming with all wireless companies demonstrating the latest technologies, outlining future directions, and of course showcasing the latest wireless products.  I just returned from Barcelona and MWC 2019, and here are some thoughts.

title: MWC 2019 Recap:  5G is here!
full_text: The biggest hit at MWC19 was flexible display technology that was shown off in 2 foldable phones, the Samsung Galaxy Fold and Huawei Mate X, and in a wearable smartwatch phone from ZTE, the nubia Alpha. While 5G was everywhere (I don’t think I saw one booth that did not mention 5G), it is just emerging into the market but will certainly take off later this year. Nokia voiced this timing in their press conference saying that they expect the first half o 2019 to be somewhat slow with 5G taking off more quickly in the second half of this year. Read this thorough summary of the event.

title: MWC19 – Barcelona Welcomes in the Era of 5G
full_text: Qorvo's Brent Dietz is back from Mobile World Congress — renamed MWC19 Barcelona — and shares his 5Gees about this year's upbeat and historic event.

title: 5Gees from MWC19
full_text: MACOM Technology Solutions and STMicroelectronics (ST) announced ST will expand 150 mm RF GaN on Si production capacity for power amplifiers supporting the initial build of 5G base stations. MACOM will invest approximately $23 million in the expansion, which is scheduled to complete this year.

title: MACOM, STMicroelectronics Accelerate GaN on Si Support for 5G Wireless Network Buildouts
full_text: The biggest hit at MWC19 was flexible display technology that was shown off in 2 foldable phones, the Samsung Galaxy Fold and Huawei Mate X, and in a wearable smartwatch phone from ZTE, the nubia Alpha. Read this review of the event.

title: MWC19 – Barcelona Welcomes in the Era of 5G and Foldable Phones
full_text: Anokiwave has announced the first in a family of third-generation silicon ICs for 5G beamforming, supporting a four channel, dual polarization system or eight channel, single polarization at 28 GHz.

title: Anokiwave Third-Generation mmWave 5G IC Family
full_text: Ericsson President and CEO Börje Ekholm says Ericsson will switch on 5G globally in 2019, backed by a strong, secure and available portfolio.

title: Ericsson to Switch on 5G Globally in 2019
full_text: Eta Wireless announced a collaboration with Rohde & Schwarz to support a new digital supply modulation technique that provides power management for the signal bandwidth required by 5G NR and mmWave devices.

title: Eta Wireless, R&S Collaborate for Power-Efficient 5G Handset Deployments
full_text: Taoglas has launched a new 5G millimeter wave beam steering antenna for the 5G frequency bands from 27.5 to 28.35 GHz.

title: Taoglas Launches 5G NR Beam Steering Gateway Antennas
full_text: N/A

title: Keysight, MediaTek Demo 5G NR IP Data Transfer Call
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced the industry's first successful demonstration of a 5G New Radio (NR) IP data transfer call using MediaTek's Helio M70 Multi-Mode Modem with integrated baseband.

title: NAB 2019: R&S Presents Solutions for 5G Broadcast, OTT, IP and Repack Program
full_text: From April 8 to 11 at NAB 19 in Las Vegas, Rohde & Schwarz will present its latest product portfolio under the motto "Supporting you today. And for the future."

title: Movandi and NXP Collaborating on mmWave for 5G
full_text: NXP Semiconductors and Movandihave formed a joint partnership to collaborate on millimeter wave solutions for 5G infrastructure. The partnership combines Movandi’s RF transceiver and systems architecture with NXP’s digital networking and signal processing portfolio.

title: Eta Wireless Introduces ETA7, First ETAdvanced Power Management IC for 5G Phones
full_text: Eta Wireless has introduced a power management IC to address the power challenges with 5G mobile phones. According to the company, this is the first power management solution for wideband millimeter wave devices, supporting the 800 MHz bandwidth defined in the 5G NR standard.

title: Keysight Assists Motorola Mobility to Commercialize First 5G NR Mobile Device
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced a collaboration with Motorola Mobility LLC, to enable the leading mobile device manufacturer in development of its first 5G new radio (NR) enabled smartphone operating in mmWave spectrum.

title: Ficosa Connects to MWC2019 with Latest 5G and V2X Technology
full_text: Ficosa leads the connected car race with the latest advanced communications technology for vehicles.

title: ADI Releases Integrated Up/Down-Converters for 5G mmWave
full_text: Analog Devices has released a pair of highly integrated up- and down-converters operating from 24 to 44 GHz — covering all 5G millimeter wave bands.

title: Qorvo Ships 100M RF Devices for 5G Wireless Infrastructure
full_text: Qorvo® has shipped over 100 million 5G wireless infrastructure components since January 2018, according to the company. New products available to wireless infrastructure customers include a dual-channel switch LNA module, ultra-low noise figure LNA and Doherty power amplifier.

title: Anritsu Introduces Field Master Pro™ MS2090A Handheld Spectrum Analyzer
full_text: Anritsu Co. introduces the Field Master Pro™ MS2090A RF handheld spectrum analyzer.

title: Skyworks Launches Sky5™ LiTE for Universal 5G Deployments
full_text: Claiming the industry’s first fully integrated front-end solution for mass tier 5G cellular applications, Skyworks Solutions has introduced Sky5™ LiTE for mass market 5G handsets.

title: Telit Transforms Wireless Broadband Networking with Blazing Fast 5G Speeds
full_text: Telit announces that it will be among the first providers of data cards based on Qualcomm Technologies’ second generation 5G NR modem, the Snapdragon X55 5G modem and their antenna modules with integrated RF transceiver, RFFE and antenna elements, representing an important milestone in the Telit roadmap.

title: Sivers IMA and Blu Wireless Demonstrate 700 m, 60 GHz Link, Achieving >1 Gbps
full_text: Sivers IMA and Blu Wireless have demonstrated data rates above 1 Gbps over a 700  m link using 5G technology in the 60 GHz unlicensed band.

title: Qorvo® Mobile 5G Portfolio Enters High-Volume Production
full_text: Qorvo® announced that its mobile 5G portfolio of highly integrated front-end modules (FEM) is entering high-volume production.

title: Skyworks Unveils Breakthrough Sky5™ Ultra Platform
full_text: Skyworks Solutions Inc. launched its most advanced 5G cellular architecture yet, the Sky5™ Ultra.

title: Skyworks, Intel Co-Develop Advanced 5G System Solutions
full_text: Skyworks Solutions Inc. and Intel Corp. announced they are creating leading-edge 5G communications engines for a broad array of end markets.

title: Qorvo® RF Fusion™ Wins Multiple Marquee Smartphone Designs
full_text: Qorvo® announced multiple new smartphone design wins utilizing the newest generation of its RF Fusion™ RF front end (RFFE) modules.

title: MediaTek, R&S Continue to Advance mmWave Measurement Technology for 5G
full_text: MediaTek and Rohde & Schwarz are collaborating to perform over-the-air (OTA) tests of MediaTek’s 5G front-end modules and antenna arrays.

title: Interview with Prof. Theodore (Ted) Rappaport of NYU WIRELESS
full_text: Interview with professor Ted Rappaport about the deployment of 5G mmWave technology.

title: Behold the Ides of March
full_text: One of the annual rites in the communications sector is Cisco’s assessment of global mobile data traffic. It arrives each February with basically the same headline: The mobile revolution is going strong. This year’s report Opens a New Window. arrived on Tuesday, detailing hundreds of millions of new mobile connections in the past year and projecting billions more in the years ahead.

title: Samsung Announces the Galaxy S10 5G
full_text: Samsung will launch a top-tier model of the Galaxy S10 that offers 5G mobile data connectivity. The device, which has a larger screen and battery than the S10 Plus, will temporarily be a Verizon Wireless exclusive before expanding to other carriers in the weeks after launch.

title: Pivotal Commware Selects MACOM as Key RF Component Supplier
full_text: Pivotal Commware, inventor of Holographic Beam Forming®, and MACOM announced MACOM’s mmWave products are designed in Pivotal’s Echo 5G product line, which improves mmWave coverage in buildings.

title: Fractus Antennas Launches Tiny 5G Mobile Antenna
full_text: Fractus Antennas announced the DUO mXTEND™, a tiny antenna booster that enables full 5G connectivity and does not require clearance area beyond its small footprint.

title: R&S Presents Integrated Signaling Test Solution for 5G NR and LTE at MWC2019
full_text: N/A

title: 5G Americas Publishes the Status of Open Source for 5G Report
full_text: 5G Americas, the industry trade association and voice of 5G and LTE for the Americas, has published The Status of Open Source for 5G, a white paper providing an overview of the 5G architecture, and its open source principles defined by 3GPP Release 15.

title: Imec Reports 2 Record-Breaking Ringamp ADCs for 5G Base Stations, Mobile Handsets
full_text: At the 2019 International Solid-State Circuits Conference (ISSCC2019), imec presented a compact, highly linear 3.2 GSps RF-sampling ADC that uses ring amplification (ringamp).

title: Molex Launches Miniaturized 2.2-5 RF Connector System, Cable Assemblies
full_text: Molex has introduced compact 2.2-5 RF Connector System and Cable Assemblies designed to deliver high frequency and low passive intermodulation (PIM).

title: Milestone Moment for 5G as Broadband Forum Delivers Recs for Converged 5G Core Network to 3GPP
full_text: A milestone moment in developing a converged 5G core network, addressing both fixed and mobile networks, has been reached after Broadband Forum delivered detailed recommendations to 3GPP.

title: Xilinx Extends its Zynq UltraScale+ RF SoC Portfolio to Full Sub-6 GHz Spectrum Support
full_text: Xilinx today announced it has extended its Zynq®  UltraScale+™ RF SoC portfolio with greater RF performance and scalability.

title: Keysight, Qualcomm Demo IIoT Application Using 5G Technology
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that at CES 2019, the company's 5G network emulation solution was used to showcase an industrial internet of things (IIoT) application from NAVER LABS with Qualcomm® 5G technology.

title: Rambus, GF to Deliver High Speed SerDes on 22FDX®
full_text: Rambus Inc. announced the availability of 32G Multi-protocol SerDes PHY on GLOBALFOUNDRIES (GF) 22 nm FD-SOI (22FDX®) platform for high-volume, high performance applications.

title: Skyworks, MediaTek Collaborate on Innovative 5G Platform
full_text: Skyworks Solutions Inc. announced that MediaTek is utilizing its Sky5™ suite for their new 5G reference platforms.

title: Anokiwave's Presence at MWC Barcelona 2019
full_text: Anokiwave announced its presence at MWC Barcelona 2019.

title: Anritsu 5G Tester Verifies MediaTek's 5G Modem
full_text: Anritsu announces MediaTek‘s Helio M70 5G modem has achieved the maximum downlink and uplink throughput using Anritsu’s Radio Communication Test Station MT8000A, providing a flexible test platform for ultra-fast, large-capacity 5G communications using wideband signal processing and beamforming.

title: GF, Dolphin Integration to Deliver Differentiated FD-SOI Adaptive Body Bias Solutions
full_text: GLOBALFOUNDRIES (GF) and Dolphin Integration announced a collaboration to develop a series of adaptive body bias (ABB) solutions to improve the energy efficiency and reliability of system on a chip (SoC) on GF’s 22nm FD-SOI (22FDX®) process technology for a wide range of high-growth applications such as 5G, IoT and automotive.

title: Keysight Launches Dual-Channel, 44 GHz Signal Generators with 2 GHz Bandwidth
full_text: Keysight Technologies has launched the first single instrument, dual-channel microwave signal generators with 2 GHz modulation bandwidth and frequency coverage to 44 GHz. The VXG signal generator is available in two configurations: a bench-top unit with touch screen interface and a modular version in a PXIe form factor.

title: Qualcomm 2nd Generation RFFE for Sleeker, More Efficient 5G Multimode Mobile Devices
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies announced its second-generation RF front-end solutions for 5G multi-mode mobile devices.

title: Qualcomm New End-to-End OTA 5G Test Networks to Drive 5G Innovation
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies Inc., a subsidiary of Qualcomm Inc., announced an expansion of its 5G test networks to include new end-to-end over-the-air (OTA) configurations for both mmWave and sub-6 GHz bands.

title: Qualcomm Showcases 5G NR Evolution with New Applications, Use Cases at MWC2019
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies Inc., a subsidiary of Qualcomm Inc., announced that it will demonstrate advanced 5G New Radio (NR) technologies at Mobile World Congress Barcelona 2019 to showcase its roadmap and the broad range 5G technology innovations and solutions being applied across new applications and use cases.

title: Qualcomm Advanced Commercial Multimode 5G Modem to Accelerate Global 5G Rollout
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies Inc., a subsidiary of Qualcomm Inc., announced the Snapdragon X55 5G modem, its second-generation 5G New Radio (NR) modem.

title: Keysight, AT&T, Anokiwave, Ball Corp., Xilinx Achieve Key Industry Milestone for Open RAN 5G
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced a collaboration with fellow O-RAN Alliance members AT&T, Anokiwave, Ball Corp. and Xilinx, accelerating development of 5G networks using an O-RAN architecture to increase flexibility for service providers.

title: Global 5G Rush But No Global 5G Handsets
full_text: 5G Americas recently published "5G Spectrum Vision," outlining the spectrum inventory opportunities for 5G in the Americas and other regions.

title: Using a COTS SDR as a 5G Development Platform
full_text: Filtronic plc announced the company has shipped 25,000 high performance E-Band transceiver modules since first entering the growing E-Band market. Systems containing Filtronic’s core E-Band technology have been successfully demonstrated at data rates up to 40 Gbps.

title: New CommScope Antennas Address Efficiency and Path to 5G
full_text: CommScope has introduced new 3.5 GHz-capable antennas for macro and small cell densification to help increase network capacity and migration to 5G.

title: LG U+ Adopts Anritsu MT1000A for 5G Rollout
full_text: Anritsu Corp. is pleased to announce that Korean operator LG U+ has decided to use Anritsu’s Network Master™ Pro MT1000A supporting speeds up to 100 Gbps for 5G service.

title: Frequency Matters, Feb 7 - Feb High Freq. Components/PCBs issue, 5G news/events
full_text: Microwave Journal editors Pat Hindle and Gary Lerude discuss the technical features in the Feb High Frequency Components and PCBs issue, 5G/smartphone news and DesignCon/MWC events. Sponsored by MACOM.

title: Industry Chat: Mapping Verizon's 5G Base Stations in Sacramento
full_text: Industry analyst Earl Lum recently mapped Verizon's 5G sites in Sacramento. In our latest chat about the wireless industry, he talks about his findings, the FCC's regulations streamlining small cell siting, Huawei's troubles and the broader implications for national security.

title: To Stand Alone or Not – That is the Question for 5G mmWave
full_text: To date, mmWave deployments have been targeted to fixed wireless access, or in other words fiber to the home (FTTP) replacements.  The early 5G sub 6 GHz rollouts are a milestone but mmWave is the pathway to the transformational impact needed for the 5G ecosystem.

title: AT&T Rejoins NYU WIRELESS
full_text: NYU WIRELESS announced AT&T has rejoined the NYU WIRELESS research center at the New York University Tandon School of Engineering. AT&T is the research center’s 13th industrial affiliate.

title: Rogers to Show Latest mmWave Multi-Layer Designs at DesignCon 2019
full_text: Rogers Corp. will return to DesignCon in Santa Clara, Calif. (at Booth #421) and show some of its high performance circuit materials: XtremeSpeed™ RO1200Ô laminates and RO4000® products used in multi-layer structures which include a family of thin laminates, bonding materials and sheeted copper foil options.

title: Keysight, Samsung Achieve Interoperability and Dev Test Milestone
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced the demonstration of maximum achievable 5G New Radio (NR) data throughput performance using the company's 5G NR network emulation solution, which is based on Keysight's UXM 5G Wireless Test Platform, and Samsung's 5G NR Exynos Modem 5100.

title: ZTE Takes Lead in Completing Phase 1 of SA 5G Core Test of China Telecom
full_text: ZTE Corp. announced that it takes the lead in completing Phase 1 of SA 5G Core Test of China Telecom, actively promoting the development and maturity of the 5G network industry chain.

title: Reports Analyze Verizon Wireless 5G FWA Network in Sacramento
full_text: EJL Wireless Research published two reports analyzing Verizon’s 5G FWA deployment in Sacramento and the return on investment for two residential neighborhood scenarios. Earl Lum, principal of EJL Wireless, surveyed 99 percent of Verizon’s 5G sites within eight districts in the city, which provided the data to assess the issues and complications with Verizon’s deployment.

title: mmWave Coalition Urges NTIA to Broaden Spectrum Access
full_text: The mmWave Coalition submitted comments to urge the National Telecommunication and Information Administration (NTIA) to facilitate greater access to spectrum above 95 GHz for non-federal use.

title: FCC Concludes 5G 28 GHz Spectrum Auction
full_text: After 176 rounds, the first U.S. millimeter wave spectrum auction for 5G, for two bands at 28 GHz, concluded Friday (January 24), raising $702.6 million for 2,965 licenses. The FCC will now auction spectrum at 24 GHz.

title: Anritsu Earns First 5G NR PCT Validation from GCF
full_text: Anritsu Corp. is pleased to announce that the Global Certification Forum (GCF) has approved the world’s first 5G NR Protocol Conformance tests on the 5G NR Mobile Device Test Platform ME7834NR at their January 2019 CAG57 meeting.

title: AVX Announces Ethertronics' New Portable mmWave Measurement System
full_text: AVX Corp. announced that Ethertronics, an AVX Group Co., has released the new Ethertronics® ETH-MMW-1000 Millimeter Measurement System: a compact, cost-effective, extremely accurate and easily adaptable portable solution for testing 5G antennas and other devices at mmWave frequencies.

title: R&S ATS-TEMP Climate Option Enables 5G Device Testing Under Extreme Temps
full_text: Rohde & Schwarz has developed a setup that enables 3D RF measurements of antenna characteristics in a temperature range from –20°C to +85°C.

title: ZTE, China Mobile Take the Lead in Completing 2.6G Hz NR Test
full_text: ZTE Corp. announced that ZTE and the Guangdong branch of China Mobile have completed the first 2.6 GHz NR test in Guangzhou 5G field trial.

title: Keysight First to Gain GCF Approval for 5G NR NSA Mobile Device Certification
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that the company has gained Global Certification Forum (GCF) approval for 5G New Radio (NR) Non-Standalone (NSA) test cases, enabling the mobile ecosystem to accelerate protocol and RF device certification.

title: NGMN, Wireless Broadband Alliance to Address RAN Convergence Opportunities
full_text: NGMN and Wireless Broadband Alliance (WBA) have published the first results of their collaboration to drive the convergence of multi-technology RANs and core networks.

title: China Unicom, ZTE Complete World's First 5G Call with ZTE's 5G Prototype Smartphone
full_text: ZTE Corp. announced that the Guangdong branch of China Unicom and ZTE have made the world's first 5G call by means of ZTE's 5G prototype smartphone in Shenzhen 5G field trial.

title: NEC Contributes to Ultra-HD Live Video Transmission Test Utilizing 5G
full_text: NEC Corp. announced that it contributed to a video transmission test utilizing 5G conducted in November 2018 by NTT DOCOMO INC. and TOBU RAILWAY CO. LTD. through the provision of 5G base stations that support 4.5 and 28 GHz bands.

title: Keysight, UNISOC Sign Agreement to Build 5G Industrial Ecology
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that the company signed an agreement, along with 17 other industry partners, that aims to strengthen industrial ecological cooperation and drive world economic growth by accelerating 5G research and commercialization.

title: Skyworks Powers Next Generation 4G/5G Mobile Hotspots
full_text: Skyworks Solutions Inc. announced that its SkyOne® Ultra 3.0 portfolio is being leveraged by Inseego, a pioneer in 5G and intelligent IoT device-to-cloud solutions, for their next-generation mobile hotspot.

title: Keysight Provides Test Solutions to SoftBank, Accelerating Deployment of 5G Tech
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that SoftBank has chosen Keysight's 5G network emulation solutions to characterize and validate new 5G New Radio (NR) mobile devices intended to operate on the Japanese mobile operator's 5G network.

title: E-Band Backhaul Demos 40 Gbps, 100 μs Round-Trip Latency Over 1.4 km Link
full_text: Ericsson and Deutsche Telekom demonstrated a 40 Gbps data rate over a 1.4 km radio link at E-Band, 4x higher than commercially available wireless radio products. The round-trip latency of the link was less than 100 μs.

title: Mitsubishi Develops 1.4 to 4.8 GHz, Digitally Controlled GaN PA for Base Stations
full_text: To support 5G, Mitsubishi Electric Corporation has developed a digitally controlled GaN power amplifier (PA) covering 1.4 to 4.8 GHz with more than 40 percent efficiency.

title: Chip Antenna-Antenna Tuner Combo Cover LTE Bands
full_text: The world is on the verge of a 5G revolution, and T-Mobile firmly believes everyone needs to benefit, not just the few. Along with Intel and Ericsson, the Un-carrier just took another step toward delivering nationwide 5G, pulling off the world’s first 5G data call and video call on 600 MHz (including successful uplink and downlink communication), both on a live commercial network.

title: T-Mobile, Ericsson, Intel Complete World’s First 5G Call on 600 MHz
full_text: Keysight Technologies has extended its collaboration with China Information and Communication Technology Group (CICT) with a new purchasing framework agreement, strengthening the two companies' commitment to develop 5G technology.

title: Keysight, CICT Collaborate on 5G with New Purchase Framework Agreement

title: 5G, The New Arms Race

title: The Blurring Lines of 5G

They didn't give details about what the device will look like, what it will be called or how much it will cost.

full_text: Active antennas, or phased arrays, have been widely used for many years. The first phased array applications were mainly military with systems deployed as early as the mid-1970s. This paper will explain the market changes behind these trends and the implications for the future.

full_text: In this technical paper, we analyze the architecture, semiconductor technology, and RF front-end (RFFE) design needed to deliver mmWave FWA services. Discussing topics such as: Scan-angle requirements, Tradeoffs of Hybrid-beamforming versus All-Digital Beamforming for the Base Transceiver Station (BTS),Analyze BTS semiconductor technology and RF front-end components, and Gallium-Nitride on Silicon Carbide (GaN-on-SiC) front-end modules (FEMs) designed specifically for the 5G FWA

title: RF Front-end Technology and Tradeoffs for 5G mmWave Fixed Wireless Access
full_text: This article is organized into 3 major topics. In the first section, we will discuss some of the leading use cases for mmwave communications and set the stage for the analysis that follows. In the second and third sections we will delve into the architectures and technology for the mmwave basestation systems. In section 2 we will discuss technology for the beamformers and how the required transmit power influences the choice of technology for the system front-end. While the beamformer gets much of the spotlight in the press, there is equally important section of the radio that performs the conversion from bits to mmwave frequency. We will present an example signal chain for this section of the system and suggest some leading-edge components from Analog Devices for radio designer’s consideration.

title: Bits to Beams – RF Technology Evolution for 5G mmwave Radios

full_text: The Strategy Analytics Strategic Component Applications (SCA) group report, “RF GaN Market Update: 2017-2022,” forecasts that RF GaN revenue will push past $1 billion by the end of the forecast timeframe.

full_text: Skyworks has unveiled wideband, 16-state antenna aperture tuners, the latest solutions from its Sky5™ portfolio, the company’s unifying platform enabling 5G applications.

full_text: Anritsu Co. introduces three software packages for its Signal Analyzer MS269x series that support measurements of RF Tx characteristics of 5G New Radio (NR) base stations and mobile devices.

title: Cinch Connectivity Solutions Announces Expansion of Johnson SMPM Series
full_text: Cinch Connectivity Solutions, a Bel group company, announces the expansion of the Johnson SMPM series. Cinch continues its support of the 5G application market by announcing additional board mount and cabled SMPM connectors within the Johnson product line.

title: SiTime, Intel Announce Collaboration on MEMS Timing for 5G
full_text: SiTime Corp. and Intel announced a collaboration to work together on integrating timing solutions for Intel’s 5G multi-mode radio modems, with additional applicability to Intel LTE, mmWave wireless, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and GNSSsolutions.

title: Anritsu Introduces Industry-First PIM Over CPRI Capability for BTS Master™
full_text: Anritsu Co. introduces PIM over CPRI software for its BTS Master™ MT8220T and MT822xB handheld base station analyzers that allow passive intermodulation (PIM) measurements to be made from the ground for the first time.

title: Telefónica, SEAT First Use Case of Assisted Driving via Mobile Network in Real Setting
full_text: Telefónica and SEAT have presented the first use case in Segovia within the framework of the 5G Technological Cities project by equipping a both a vehicle and road infrastructure with technology enabling the exchange of information, making it the first step towards V2X vehicular communication using existing mobile networks in a real urban setting.

title: China Kills Qualcomm's $44B Deal for NXP
full_text: Qualcomm confirmed it was terminating its proposed takeover of Dutch counterpart NXP on Thursday after China failed to grant it regulatory approval. Qualcomm said it would proceed with a stock buyback of up to $30 billion that it had promised shareholders should the NXP deal fall apart. NXP also announced Thursday that it would buy back shares worth $5 billion.

title: Microsemi Announces Newest Network Synchronization IC Product Family
full_text: Microsemi Corp. announced its newest network synchronization integrated circuit (IC) product family for Synchronous Ethernet (SyncE) and IEEE™ 1588 timing and line card applications.

title: Qualcomm Introduces Sub-6 GHz and mmWave Modules for 5G Smartphones
full_text: Qualcomm Technologies is sampling integrated 5G new radio (NR) modules for the sub-6 GHz and millimeter wave bands, an industry first. Four of the millimeter wave modules will fit in a smartphone, allowing phone manufacturers to incorporate these bands without sacrificing the attractive industrial designs of their mobile devices.

title: Keysight Joins EU Project 5G-VINNI to Accelerate Acceptance of 5G Across Europe
full_text: Keysight Technologies announced the company was the only test, measurement and network visibility company to be selected to play a key role in a new European (EU) project: 5G Verticals INNovation Infrastructure (5G-VINNI), intended to accelerate the acceptance of 5G across Europe.

title: Charlotte, Raleigh and Oklahoma City to Receive AT&T 5G Service Before Year-End
full_text: Charlotte, Raleigh and Oklahoma City will join Dallas, Atlanta and Waco, Texas, as cities receiving AT&T’s mobile 5G service this year. AT&T has said it will deploy mobile 5G in a dozen cities by the end of the year.

title: Keysight Joins 5G Device Forerunner Initiative Led by China Mobile
full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that it has signed a MoU with CMCC (China Mobile Communication Corporation) in support of the 5G Device Forerunner Initiative project.

title: Anritsu MT8000A Supports MediaTek 5G Chipsets
full_text: MediaTek Inc. and Anritsu Corp. have agreed to forge a partnership for 5G development and physical layer verification.

full_text: N/A

title: Is 5G Really Done?
full_text: I had the opportunity to speak at the IEEE sponsored 5G World Forum last week in Santa Clara.  My talk focused on areas of research not necessarily related to the current 5G specification or 3GPP Release 15. The purpose of my presentation was not to rehash 5G, but to instead highlight areas that will help 5G reach its potential.

title: North American 5G Development Buoys Ericsson Quarterly Results
full_text: The rollout of 5G in North America buoyed Ericsson’s second quarter financial results, arguably the highlight of a mixed quarter of declining year-over-year sales, improving margins, and greater net income loss.

title: Akoustis Announces BAW Filter Design Win, Commercial Production Order
full_text: Akoustis Technologies announced its first production order for initial quantities of a 3.8 GHz BAW filter. The order, from a “well-established military OEM,” is the company's first BAW filter design win above 3 GHz.

title: FCC Exploring Mid-Band Satellite Spectrum for Mobile 5G, Other Uses
full_text: The FCC has adopted a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) proposing flexible use for 500 MHz of mid-band spectrum between 3.7 and 4.2 GHz. Seeking to allocate spectrum for new wireless uses while treating existing users fairly, the FCC asks Fixed Satellite Service (FSS) earth stations operating in the band to certify the accuracy of their existing registration and license information, part of the commission's effort to understand how the band is being used.

title: NI, Spirent Communications Collaborate on 5G Performance Test Solution
full_text: NI and Spirent Communications plc announced their collaboration to develop test systems for 5G New Radio (NR) devices.

title: NI mmWave Radio Heads Targeted at 5G NR Research, System Prototyping
full_text: NI announced two series of new millimeter wave radio heads for the mmWave Transceiver System. The new radio heads, which cover spectrum from 24.5 to 33.4 and 37 to 43.5 GHz, are targeted at wireless researchers prototyping 5G New Radio (NR) systems.

title: R&S Participates in China Mobile's 5G Device Forerunner Initiative, Signs MoU
full_text: China Mobile Terminal Co. Ltd. together with the China Mobile Research Institute, on behalf of China Mobile, signed MoU with 28 partners. Rohde & Schwarz signed the MoU for the 5G Device Forerunner Initiative as a representative of the T&M industry.

title: Akoustis Completes Technology Qual for Single Crystal BAW Filters
full_text: BAW filter manufacturer Akoustis Technologies has completed the qualification of its first-generation XBAW wafer technology and the attendant single crystal materials process at its Canandaigua, New York wafer fab. New products will now begin in the pre-production phase and won’t require end-to-end qualification, which will shorten the development time for catalog and custom components.

title: Mobile, GNSS in Single Antenna Package from Fractus Antennas
full_text: Fractus Antennas has just launched a new reference design that explains how to use the TRIO mXTEND™ chip antenna component to get the GNSS and mobile frequency bands at the same time.

full_text: Keysight Technologies Inc. announced that the company is extending its collaboration with UNISOC Inc. to participate in the CMCC 5G large-scale trials.

title: Keysight, MediaTek to Accelerate 5G NR Chipset Development, Protocol Stacks Testing
full_text: Keysight Technologies announced it is extending its collaboration with MediaTek to accelerate 5G New Radio (NR) chipset development and testing of 5G NR protocol stacks.
